(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 31814, 'date': '2020-08-18 10:27:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

To Liu Yulong:
    About the functional test cases, since Linux checks if the next hop is reachable when adding a route, if I call the update route function and there is no real next hop address in the test environment, the route will not be added.
   I'm really sorry that I don't seem to be able to add functional test cases for this function."}, {'account_id': 31814, 'date': '2020-08-20 09:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-08-20 12:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-29 02:00:32.000000000', 'message': 'L3 router support ECMP

This patch changes the policy for updating routes to support ECMP,
and will now add ECMP routes to the Neutron router namespace when
there are multiple routes pointing to the same destination address.

Change-Id: I842c1408ee0235bc54441e9ed69c8b87ea30651b
Related-Bug: #1880532
'}, {'created': '2020-08-07 02:38:15.000000000', 'message': 'L3 router support ECMP

commit_message:
L3 router support ECMP

This patch changes the policy for updating routes to support ECMP,
and will now add ECMP routes to the Neutron router namespace when
there are multiple routes pointing to the same destination address.

Change-Id: I842c1408ee0235bc54441e9ed69c8b87ea30651b
Related-Bug: #1880532

The puppet-ironic module's ipxe support does not align with current
versions of ironic which delineated ipxe and pxe support quite some
time ago.

This is an attempt to reconcile this.

Conflicts:
	manifests/pxe.pp

Backport notes:
- This change includes the following follow-up commits.

    Make ipxe bootfile name configurable
    commit 918b3116634d1be812aa5e0359eff9119ffe87a6

    Fix incorrect handling/update about deprecated parameters
    commit b307c40f353d6f8e965e9c9d52382fe7b0145043

    Fix usage of ironic::pxe::common
    commit c21b1e8db6ece50f19c09b38ead3f7d5ec84249c

- This change keeps default of uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name to ipxe.efi to
  be aligned with the default in ironic stable/wallaby (and older).

- The ip_version parameter is not depecated by this backport because

- The change in default values were reverted as much as possible.

Change-Id: Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b

commit_message:
Clean up ipxe support

The puppet-ironic module's ipxe support does not align with current
versions of ironic which delineated ipxe and pxe support quite some
time ago.

This is an attempt to reconcile this.

Conflicts:
	manifests/pxe.pp

Backport notes:
- This change includes the following follow-up commits.

    Make ipxe bootfile name configurable
    commit d99a51d17b7ae254d03225dd763f56cd90465bcb

    Fix incorrect handling/update about deprecated parameters
    commit b307c40f353d6f8e965e9c9d52382fe7b0145043

    Fix usage of ironic::pxe::common
    commit c21b1e8db6ece50f19c09b38ead3f7d5ec84249c

- This change keeps default of uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name to ipxe.efi to
  be aligned with the default in ironic stable/wallaby (and older).

- The ip_version parameter is not depecated by this backport because
  the parameter is still valid.

- The change in default values were reverted as much as possible.

Change-Id: Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b
(cherry picked from commit 3864e15998b5b1eec7d2b1b4911add9bb899fdb8)
(cherry picked from commit 7cc374a063c84d56a5d971776e46a6157636f552)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-25 10:53:29.000000000', 'message': "[ovn]: Enable network logging in neutron service plugins

the security-group logging functionality.

commit_message:
[ovn]: Enable network logging in neutron service plugins

NeutronServicePlugins needs to include 'log' in order to support
the security-group logging functionality.

Also added log to deployment/neutron/neutron-base.yaml as part of
the default NeutronServicePlugins.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/768129
Change-Id: I08fedd65bb4c97bbd73bf966ae763e4cdedebab2
Related-Bug: #1914757
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

Apparently, connection to the agent can fail with

    Unexpected error when processing next clean step.
    SSLError: ('timed out',): ssl.SSLError: ('timed out',)

This change adds SSLError to retriable errors since most of them are
related to temporary conditions, and the certificate validation failure
is handled by requests separately.

Change-Id: I4805d410b4bc98196e77d8c44a217e363dc88f0a
(cherry picked from commit 528eb9e4a99762dea5ef5e08f3dd42d459ce2d1c)

commit_message:
Retry stdlib ssl.SSLError

Apparently, connection to the agent can fail with

    Unexpected error when processing next clean step.
    SSLError: ('timed out',): ssl.SSLError: ('timed out',)

This change adds SSLError to retriable errors since most of them are
related to temporary conditions, and the certificate validation failure
is handled by requests separately.

Change-Id: I4805d410b4bc98196e77d8c44a217e363dc88f0a
(cherry picked from commit 528eb9e4a99762dea5ef5e08f3dd42d459ce2d1c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-21 01:21:02.000000000', 'message': "Clean up ipxe support

The puppet-ironic module's ipxe support does not align with current
versions of ironic which delineated ipxe and pxe support quite some
time ago.

This is an attempt to reconcile this and also change the default
ipxe binary for EFI from ipxe.efi which is intended to contain
firmware, and snponly.efi which only has the EFI networking stack.
In the vast majority of cases, short of very broken EFI firmware,
operators need snponly.efi.

Change-Id: Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b
(cherry picked from commit 3864e15998b5b1eec7d2b1b4911add9bb899fdb8)

firmware, and snponly.efi which only has the EFI networking stack.
In the vast majority of cases, short of very broken EFI firmware,
operators need snponly.efi.

Conflicts:
	manifests/pxe.pp

Change-Id: Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b

commit_message:
Clean up ipxe support

The puppet-ironic module's ipxe support does not align with current
versions of ironic which delineated ipxe and pxe support quite some
time ago.

This is an attempt to reconcile this.

Conflicts:
	manifests/pxe.pp

Backport notes:
- This change includes the following follow-up commits.

    Make ipxe bootfile name configurable
    commit d99a51d17b7ae254d03225dd763f56cd90465bcb

    Fix incorrect handling/update about deprecated parameters
    commit b307c40f353d6f8e965e9c9d52382fe7b0145043

    Fix usage of ironic::pxe::common
    commit c21b1e8db6ece50f19c09b38ead3f7d5ec84249c

- This change keeps default of uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name to ipxe.efi to
  be aligned with the default in ironic stable/wallaby (and older).

- The ip_version parameter is not depecated by this backport because
  the parameter is still valid.

- The change in default values were reverted as much as possible.

Change-Id: Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b
(cherry picked from commit 3864e15998b5b1eec7d2b1b4911add9bb899fdb8)

commit_message:
Fix ppc64le support to coexist with PXE preference

In essence, the pxe preference doesn't apply to ppc64le.

This is because PXE data loading is part of the firmware and
does not use an intermediate boot loader like ipxe, syslinux,
or even grub.

Changes the logic to always set the stage for PXE based
deployments and enables boot setting awareness for ppc64le
based on the TFTP defaults. This allows ppc64le to coexist
with an environment preferring HTTP transport like those
used with iPXE.

Change-Id: I27fa53700c1b44f14725bc66b929732553da58f8

[{'created': '2021-08-05 11:06:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix delete subscription

When trying to delete a subscription that doesn't exist Ironic
returns 500 (default code from IronicException), this commit updates
the code to 404 to show that the subscription doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I81907be1ebc293118f5ffde4fd4d0485ade390df
"}, {'created': '2021-08-05 13:16:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix subscription vendor passthru

* Instead of specifying the fields we want to oomit from create/get
subscription, now we are specifying the fields we want to be returned
(This will avoid problems when vendors are using different versions)

* When validating create_subscription are requiring that Context and
Protocol are present, use the default value from Redfish in case
they are not present in the Body request.

* When trying to delete a subscription that doesn't exist Ironic
returns 500 (default code from IronicException), this commit updates
the code to 404 to show that the subscription doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I81907be1ebc293118f5ffde4fd4d0485ade390df
"}]
commit_message:
Fix subscription vendor passthru

* Instead of specifying the fields we want to oomit from create/get
subscription, now we are specifying the fields we want to be returned
(This will avoid problems when vendors are using different versions)

* When validating create_subscription are requiring that Context and
Protocol are present, use the default value from Redfish in case
they are not present in the Body request.

* When trying to delete a subscription that doesn't exist Ironic
returns 500 (default code from IronicException), this commit updates
the code to 404 to show that the subscription doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I81907be1ebc293118f5ffde4fd4d0485ade390df

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 08:48:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix duplicate BDMs in compute manager

When attaching a volume to a running instance the nova-api validates that
the volume is not already attached to the instance. However nova-compute
is responsible for actually creating the BDM entry in the database.
If sending attach requests fast enough it can be possible that the same
"attach_volume" request can be sent to nova-compute for the same
volume/instance combination.

To work around this we add a check in nova-compute to validate that
the volume has not been attached in the mean time.

Change-Id: I92f35514efddcb071c7094370b79d91d34c5bc72
'}, {'created': '2021-07-23 12:39:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix duplicate BDMs in compute manager

When attaching a volume to a running instance the nova-api validates that
the volume is not already attached to the instance. However nova-compute
is responsible for actually creating the BDM entry in the database.
If sending attach requests fast enough it can be possible that the same
"attach_volume" request can be sent to nova-compute for the same
volume/instance combination.

To work around this we add a check in nova-compute to validate that
the volume has not been attached in the mean time.

Closes-Bug: #1937375
Change-Id: I92f35514efddcb071c7094370b79d91d34c5bc72
'}, {'created': '2021-07-23 13:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Avoid duplicate BDMs during reserve_block_device_name

commit_message:
compute: Avoid duplicate BDMs during reserve_block_device_name

When attaching a volume to a running instance the nova-api validates
that the volume is not already attached to the instance. However
nova-compute is responsible for actually creating the BDM entry in the
database. If sending attach requests fast enough it can be possible
that the same "attach_volume" request can be sent to nova-compute for
the same volume/instance combination.

To work around this we add a check in nova-compute to validate that
the volume has not been attached in the mean time.

Closes-Bug: #1937375
Change-Id: I92f35514efddcb071c7094370b79d91d34c5bc72

commit_message:
Set ganesha_vip when no StoragetNFS network

is deployed.

Normally when Ganesha is deployed for CephFS through NFS,
the StorageNFS isolated network is deployed and we set
the address for ganesha_vip on that network.  But with
Standalone role the StorageNFS network is not deployed
so ganesha_vip is not set in the tripleo hieradata unless
it is provided by extra config.

Set it to net_vip_map.external in the event that it has
not been set on the StorageNFS network.  Note that external
is chosen rather than ctlplane since the VIP must be reachable
from compute instances, guest VMs, that should have no access
to the ctlplane network.

Closes-Bug: #1911022
Change-Id: Ia97533c0b8b3b8498a173e1d363323dcdc77cce4

commit_message:
zuul: Mark live migration jobs as non-voting due to bug #1912310

Bug #1912310 details an underlying QEMU live migration failure seen
during both volume backend and block migration based live migration
tests in the nova-live-migration job. The failure rate is getting high
enough now that we should mark these jobs as non-voting until it is
resolved.

Change-Id: Ifc211fadb3ca9c7c0a74d7dcd225bdb3f3008d26
Related-Bug: #1912310

commit_message:
Add spec for vm evacuations for host recovery

When large scale hosts failed in the same time, there would be
not enough resources to recovery all the instances. So it needs
a priority to determine which one to evacuate firstly. Moreover,
the user even wants to recall the instances to the original host
after host recovery. So it needs to keep some necessary information
aboud evacuations for new features.

Change-Id: I7c87c8d4a2ab5898d1b0d046a1377fe1ed7c79ee
Blueprint: vm-evacuations-for-host-recovery

[{'created': '2021-08-05 14:18:42.000000000', 'message': "Retry stdlib ssl.SSLError

Apparently, connection to the agent can fail with

    Unexpected error when processing next clean step.
    SSLError: ('timed out',): ssl.SSLError: ('timed out',)

This change adds SSLError to retriable errors since most of them are
related to temporary conditions, and the certificate validation failure
is handled by requests separately.

Change-Id: I4805d410b4bc98196e77d8c44a217e363dc88f0a
"}]
commit_message:
Retry stdlib ssl.SSLError

Apparently, connection to the agent can fail with

    Unexpected error when processing next clean step.
    SSLError: ('timed out',): ssl.SSLError: ('timed out',)

This change adds SSLError to retriable errors since most of them are
related to temporary conditions, and the certificate validation failure
is handled by requests separately.

Change-Id: I4805d410b4bc98196e77d8c44a217e363dc88f0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-30 00:27:52.000000000', 'message': "Defer checking image size until instance info is built

The image size check is skipped if the image is raw and will be
streamed directly to disk. However metalsmith does not expose
instance_info so it is not possible to set image_disk_format=raw.

image_disk_format is detected and set during
build_instance_info_for_deploy but this is run *after* the call to
check_image_size. This results in large raw whole-disk images always
failing check_image_size when deployed by metalsmith (or any time
image_disk_format isn't explicitly set).

This change avoids that by moving the check_image_size call out of
validate to after the call to build_instance_info_for_deploy.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I5da43dc244c1a4fa828a00c02e3aa5b5f1b71e14
(cherry picked from commit ad3ce797cfbd0093fcb1bafb8aaa38c39f08926a)
"}]
commit_message:
Defer checking image size until instance info is built

The image size check is skipped if the image is raw and will be
streamed directly to disk. However metalsmith does not expose
instance_info so it is not possible to set image_disk_format=raw.

image_disk_format is detected and set during
build_instance_info_for_deploy but this is run *after* the call to
check_image_size. This results in large raw whole-disk images always
failing check_image_size when deployed by metalsmith (or any time
image_disk_format isn't explicitly set).

This change avoids that by moving the check_image_size call out of
validate to after the call to build_instance_info_for_deploy.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I5da43dc244c1a4fa828a00c02e3aa5b5f1b71e14
(cherry picked from commit ad3ce797cfbd0093fcb1bafb8aaa38c39f08926a)

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Install neutron-tempest-plugin from source

It seems the current latest version of neutron-tempest-plugin available
in pip is not compatible with the latest tempest. Let's install it
from source so that we can always install the version compatible with
tempest.

Note:
Added version pin for stable backports.

Conflicts:
	run_tests.sh

Resolved conflict caused by version pin for python 2.

Change-Id: I57f84757a229feb4e7d94ec912d723bf02392c88
(cherry picked from commit 7b8b11a8cfe98e6b2f08c3edc6b9b9222edeb937)
(cherry picked from commit 2e4793c0707274e90d7d8ebf7c2b4a01d432f2b7)
(cherry picked from commit c325bcf568d6f0dfeaa9dfca92782e88ec4eed5a)

Change-Id: Ibd58431008619a804fecb77f16b251b6b0213165
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the module path in litmus job

This change fixes the path used to obtain a list of installed modules,
so that config files and log files for the enabled services are
properly captured during litmus jobs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-02 15:40:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Cleanup container_manage

Via I214127ebeddbef2b85cc8deb3c108c8de907ee0a↲ ("Container manage module") we stopped
calling tasks/podman/start_order.yml:
-  include_tasks: podman/start_order.yml

Since start_order is not being used any longer we can remove it (and its
inclusions that are not used anywhere else):
1) start_order.yml
$ grep -ir start_order
tasks/podman/start_order.yml:- name: "Batching items for start_order {{ order }}"

2) The manage.yml
$ grep -ir -e yml -e yaml tasks/podman/start_order.yml
  include_tasks: podman/manage.yml
$ grep -ir manage.yml
tasks/podman/start_order.yml:  include_tasks: podman/manage.yml
$

3) The exec and create yml files in manage.yml:
$ grep -ir -e yml -e yaml tasks/podman/manage.yml
  include_tasks: podman/exec.yml
  include_tasks: podman/create.yml
$ grep -ir exec.yml
tasks/podman/manage.yml:  include_tasks: podman/exec.yml
$ grep -ir create.yml
tasks/main.yml:      include_tasks: create.yml #
tasks/podman/manage.yml:  include_tasks: podman/create.yml

Change-Id: I1abb75eb1bd62df2cf57b7376da9c50bb922db12
'}, {'created': '2021-08-03 10:40:38.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup tripleo_container_manage

Via I214127ebeddbef2b85cc8deb3c108c8de907ee0a↲ ("Container manage module") we stopped

$ grep -ir start_order
tasks/podman/start_order.yml:- name: "Batching items for start_order {{ order }}"

2) The manage.yml

3) The exec and create yml files in manage.yml:

commit_message:
Cleanup tripleo_container_manage

Via I214127ebeddbef2b85cc8deb3c108c8de907ee0a↲ ("Container manage module") we stopped
calling tasks/podman/start_order.yml.
Since start_order is not being used any longer we can remove it (and its
inclusions that are not used anywhere else):
1) start_order.yml
$ grep -ir start_order
tasks/podman/start_order.yml:- name: "Batching items for start_order {{ order }}"

2) The manage.yml
$ grep -ir -e yml -e yaml tasks/podman/start_order.yml
  include_tasks: podman/manage.yml
$ grep -ir manage.yml
tasks/podman/start_order.yml:  include_tasks: podman/manage.yml
$

3) The exec and create yml files in manage.yml:
$ grep -ir -e yml -e yaml tasks/podman/manage.yml
  include_tasks: podman/exec.yml
  include_tasks: podman/create.yml
$ grep -ir exec.yml
tasks/podman/manage.yml:  include_tasks: podman/exec.yml
$ grep -ir create.yml
tasks/main.yml:      include_tasks: create.yml #
tasks/podman/manage.yml:  include_tasks: podman/create.yml

Also verified that THT does not manually include any of the tasks we're
removing here:
$ grep -ir -e 'start_order.yaml' -e 'manage.yml' -e 'create.yml' -e 'exec.yml' tripleo-heat-templates
$

Also deployed a BGP test env with this change and was able to deploy the
overcloud correctly.

Change-Id: I1abb75eb1bd62df2cf57b7376da9c50bb922db12

commit_message:
Create SG rule for Octavia log offloading

A SG rule for Octavia log offloading (syslog on UDP 514) was
missing, and now that the security-group has been added to the
management port, it's required for receiving the amphora logs.

Change-Id: I6e0455e13a2f1351b072f11c98dfc79fecf847fb

commit_message:
Remove the usage of ansible_date_time

As this playbook is mainly intended to be used from the openstack CLI,
whose ansible runner has purposely disabled inject_facts_as_vars[1],
along with the default usage of the "smart" gathering_policy that does
not updates the facts on every run (which destroys the purpose of
attaching timestamps to files to get keep different files from different
runs), it seems better to re-introduce the previous way of implementing
dynamic (timestamped based) names[2]

This way uses the "date" OS command to obtain always a different
timestamp without mandating a new gather_facts every execution nor
having to use facts not injected as vars.

Not a clean cherry-pick due to the renaming of the role from
backup_and_restore to backup-and-restore.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/800934/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#37
[2]
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/795330/3/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#43

Change-Id: Ia0898c022604040a87b027f35a5878086ff80b50
(cherry picked from commit be78f721245e5b47c58273e2c2744d34c71bb393)
(cherry picked from commit 86bb76a6d1ab5ad80d1d5e97ac6c36fc32452b6e)

commit_message:
Enable security group on the Octavia management port

A dedicated security group (lb-health-mgr-sec-grp) is created for the
Octavia management port but it was unused as the port was created with
no-security-groups.
This commit enables this security group of the health-manager port.

Change-Id: Ib7ec0d194d9858b115ba9343a7117aa1f4d264ea

commit_message:
Remove the usage of ansible_date_time

As this playbook is mainly intended to be used from the openstack CLI,
whose ansible runner has purposely disabled inject_facts_as_vars[1],
along with the default usage of the "smart" gathering_policy that does
not updates the facts on every run (which destroys the purpose of
attaching timestamps to files to get keep different files from different
runs), it seems better to re-introduce the previous way of implementing
dynamic (timestamped based) names[2]

This way uses the "date" OS command to obtain always a different
timestamp without mandating a new gather_facts every execution nor
having to use facts not injected as vars.

Not a clean cherry-pick due to a conflict with variables.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/800934/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#37
[2]
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/795330/3/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#43

commit_message:
Remove the usage of ansible_date_time

As this playbook is mainly intended to be used from the openstack CLI,
whose ansible runner has purposely disabled inject_facts_as_vars[1],
along with the default usage of the "smart" gathering_policy that does
not updates the facts on every run (which destroys the purpose of
attaching timestamps to files to get keep different files from different
runs), it seems better to re-introduce the previous way of implementing
dynamic (timestamped based) names[2]

This way uses the "date" OS command to obtain always a different
timestamp without mandating a new gather_facts every execution nor
having to use facts not injected as vars.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/800934/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#37
[2]
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/795330/3/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#43

Change-Id: Ia0898c022604040a87b027f35a5878086ff80b50
(cherry picked from commit be78f721245e5b47c58273e2c2744d34c71bb393)
(cherry picked from commit 86bb76a6d1ab5ad80d1d5e97ac6c36fc32452b6e)

commit_message:
Online backup of the galera database must desynchronize the node before backup

This fix aims to desynchonize the current node of the galera database to
avoid receiving any writes or syncs from the master node while the
backup is being performed, ensuring the consistency of the dump.

This procedure is specified on the product manual [1].

Not a clean cherry pick due to different naming of the role directory.

[1] https://galeracluster.com/library/training/tutorials/galera-backup.html

Closes-Bug: #1934654

Change-Id: I879abd53a17402a0860557d8e0e31ab0c560fcd4
(cherry picked from commit dea5ae05694a64634bfc3df63bc176a1cbeab585)
(cherry picked from commit bf60d71718f442296280080215f2de75cb8271ac)
(cherry picked from commit 69a4efe4bfed592e187faa41609ba07c526a8fae)

commit_message:
frr: Add entry points to be able to customize the config

For example, this can be useful to inject some custom lines
at different points. Tested with increasing debug level for frr:
  ControllerExtraGroupVars:
    tripleo_frr_conf_custom_globals: |
      debug bfd peer
      debug bfd network
      debug bfd zebra
      debug bgp graceful-restart
      debug bgp neighbor-events
      debug bgp updates
      debug bgp update-groups

And correctly got the lines in frr.conf:
[root@ctrl-1-0 frr]# grep -B2 ^debug /var/lib/config-data/ansible-generated/frr/etc/frr/frr.conf |head -n5
service integrated-vtysh-config
line vty
debug bfd peer
debug bfd network
debug bfd zebra

Change-Id: Iac6c0acb49582aeddead718834a8fe9d84babb15

commit_message:
CI: Test ironic puppet manifests in standalone job

This change ensures that any change in puppet-tripleo related to Ironic
triggers the senario 012 standalone job which enables Ironic.

Change-Id: I8fc972a1c1b3c7fd52ae24acc8c8334d7b7e32d2

commit_message:
CI: Trigger standalone job for changes related to iscsid

This change ensures that the standalone job with cinder iscsi(lvm)
backend is executed when any template or puppet manifest for iscsid
service is updated.

Change-Id: I1bff7d664aac833fc5704ede5fd58f7fac0f3e4b

Is there no way to use a decorator on the volume manager.delete_volume instead of reworking and adding the confusing calls.   

I was a bit confused by the addition of driver_delete_volume, which is simply a wrapper for delete_volume with the additional call to cleanup the locks.   I would think a more elegant solution is to use a decorator that is executed at return time only to nuke the locks ?'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2021-06-24 09:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

> Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1
> Is there no way to use a decorator on the volume manager.delete_volume instead of reworking and adding the confusing calls.

Yes, that's definitely a more elegant and cleaner solution.  I'll update the code.

> I was a bit confused by the addition of driver_delete_volume, which is simply a wrapper for delete_volume with the additional call to cleanup the locks.   I would think a more elegant solution is to use a decorator that is executed at return time only to nuke the locks ?

That would mean we have to change ALL the drivers' "delete_volume" methods to add the decorator, and have the risk that a new driver doesn't add it and then we leave locks behind.  Unlike the other case, here a decorator on the manager methods won't work for this, since some times we delete multiple resources (like in "_delete_group_generic" or "_delete_group_snapshot_generic") and others we delete a volume that was created within the method and the decorator can't know about (like in "_revert_top_snapshot_generic").'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2021-06-24 11:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 28801, 'date': '2021-06-24 12:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-18 14:41:48.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Remove file locks once we delete a volume

To avoid leaving leftover locks we delete them on volume and snapshot
deletion.

Right now this is only relevant for Active-Passive deployments, because
Active-Active deployments don't use dynamic file locks (may change if
drivers start using them) and TooZ non-file drivers tend to clean up
after themselves (ie: etcd3).

This will alleviate the ever increasing files in the locks directory.
Deployment tools should implement a service that runs at startup and
cleans of the locks directory before the OpenStack services are started.

PS: Path is missing unit tests, manual testing, and release note
Change-Id: Ic73ee64257aeb024383c6cb79f2e8c04810aaf69
"}, {'created': '2020-06-08 16:42:01.000000000', 'message': 'Remove file locks once we delete a resource

File locks are never removed from the system, so they keep increasing in
the locks directory, which can become problematic.

In this patch we start trying to delete these lock files when we delete
a volume or a snapshot.

This affects the 2 type of file locks we currently have:
- Using oslo lockutils synchronized with external=True
- Using coordination.synchronized when deployed in Active-Passive and no
  DLM

This will alleviate the ever increasing files in the locks directory.
Deployment tools should implement a service that runs when the host is
booting and cleans of the locks directory before the OpenStack services
are started.

Partial-Bug: #1432387
Change-Id: Ic73ee64257aeb024383c6cb79f2e8c04810aaf69
'}, {'created': '2020-06-23 12:44:23.000000000', 'message': 'Remove file locks once we delete a resource

File locks are never removed from the system, so they keep increasing in
the locks directory, which can become problematic.

In this patch we start trying to delete these lock files when we delete
a volume or a snapshot.

This affects the 2 type of file locks we currently have:
- Using oslo lockutils synchronized with external=True
- Using coordination.synchronized when deployed in Active-Passive and no
  DLM

This will alleviate the ever increasing files in the locks directory.
Deployment tools should implement a service that runs when the host is
booting and cleans of the locks directory before the OpenStack services
are started.

Partial-Bug: #1432387
Change-Id: Ic73ee64257aeb024383c6cb79f2e8c04810aaf69

a volume or a snapshot.

This affects the 2 type of file locks we currently have:
- Using oslo lockutils synchronized with external=True
- Using coordination.synchronized when deployed in Active-Passive and no
  DLM

This will alleviate the ever increasing files in the locks directory.
Deployment tools should implement a service that runs when the host is
booting and cleans of the locks directory before the OpenStack services
are started.

commit_message:
Remove file locks once we delete a resource

File locks are never removed from the system, so they keep increasing in
the locks directory, which can become problematic.

In this patch we start trying to delete these lock files when we delete
a volume or a snapshot.

This affects the 2 type of file locks we currently have:
- Using oslo lockutils synchronized with external=True
- Using coordination.synchronized when deployed in Active-Passive and no
  DLM

This will alleviate the ever increasing files in the locks directory.
Deployment tools should implement a service that runs when the host is
booting and cleans of the locks directory before the OpenStack services
are started.

Partial-Bug: #1432387
Change-Id: Ic73ee64257aeb024383c6cb79f2e8c04810aaf69

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-31 16:08:28.000000000', 'message': 'Restore original time override in test_archive_task_logs

Change I9b16a3a849937aba5b90ed1ab9a80b7f0103f673 attempted to fix a
non-determinstic failure in the test_archive_task_logs functional test
by adding a time override. That fix however missed that the
osloutils_fixture.TimeFixture clears the time override when it exits
and that does not mean a previous time override will be restored.

This removes usage of the osloutils_fixture.TimeFixture and instead
sets time overrides and restores previous time overrides. Restoration
of the original time overrides also made an adjustment to the --before
option value necessary in order to pick up the first task_log record.

Closes-Bug: #1934519

Change-Id: Ic28d2e53d5f50e89635e19df08699f2b8c5cea84
'}]
commit_message:
Restore original time override in test_archive_task_logs

Change I9b16a3a849937aba5b90ed1ab9a80b7f0103f673 attempted to fix a
non-determinstic failure in the test_archive_task_logs functional test
by adding a time override. That fix however missed that the
osloutils_fixture.TimeFixture clears the time override when it exits
and that does not mean a previous time override will be restored.

This removes usage of the osloutils_fixture.TimeFixture and instead
sets time overrides and restores previous time overrides. Restoration
of the original time overrides also made an adjustment to the --before
option value necessary in order to pick up the first task_log record.

Closes-Bug: #1934519

Change-Id: Ic28d2e53d5f50e89635e19df08699f2b8c5cea84

commit_message:
Skip DVR binding for ports with invalid OFPORT

Invalid OFPORT (-1) causes ofctl errors and timeouts if set
it as output in a flow rule.

Closes-Bug: #1938685
Change-Id: Ib8be66c3068309832e08066af4e0b75c30e8163a

If the resource you are rotating for example has a maxUnavailable: 0 and say the probes have a tight timer and it times out?'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2021-06-21 22:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2021-06-21 23:00:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(4 comments)

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> How does one know this rotate successfully? Is this performing a best effort rotation? If the resource you are rotating for example has a maxUnavailable: 0 and say the probes have a tight timer and it times out?

If I understanding your comment correctly, you mean once the certificates are renewed, how do we know if the new certificates have been updated in the pods that are using these certificates. Yes it is best effort. You are correct that if maxUnavailable: 0 and the probes have a tight timer and it times out. yes the pods will restart and there might be service disruption. If any deployment have such configuration (which will be troublesome anyways) then they may have to turn this cron job off and do manual rotation.'}, {'account_id': 19391, 'date': '2021-07-01 19:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24780, 'date': '2021-07-07 19:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2021-07-07 19:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2021-07-07 19:34:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I do not like the timing of the default schedule for rotation (1st of the month), but I won't block this. Would also like to be sure that previous concerns have been addressed."}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2021-08-02 15:19:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

It seems a little strange to have a cron job that forces cert rotation to happen, when cert-manager itself has a timing mechanism built-in.  Would it make more sense to have the bit of code here which deletes pods simply watch the certificates, so when cert-manager rotates them the pods get deleted at that time?  However it sounds like this design is already set, so I'm ok with going forward if we can consider alternatives in the future."}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2021-08-02 15:46:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I won't repeat for Gage and McEuen's comments on this, but I do agree with them.  I had an additional concern on having all impacted resources restarted automaticallly, as in some cases admin may not want certain resources to restart automatically, but in a more control fashion (such as a change window)."}, {'account_id': 33519, 'date': '2021-08-02 15:56:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

Agree with what other folks said before. Having a different set of scheduler independent of the cert-manager's rotation introduces potential configuration problems for other deployers. As previous changes indicate, deployers using wrong values can potentially cause deployment issues they didn't anticipate. We are putting a lot of onus on the deployer to do the math and make sure this doesn't break. Perhaps documentation would help with this upstream consumption of these values."}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2021-08-02 19:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
cert-rotation: New chart for certificate rotation

This chart creates a cronjob which monitors the expiry of the
certificates created by jetstack cert-manager. It rotates the
certificates and restarts the pods that mounts the certificate
secrets so that the new certificate can take effect.

Change-Id: I492b5f319cf0f2e7ccbbcf516953e17aafc1c59f

commit_message:
trivial: Fix note indentation in volume-encryption docs

The volume encryption does have a code snippet above a note. The
rendered version of the document doesn't actually render the note
because it's translated as configuration ini format.

Change-Id: I82d067a9a22080a6c69d85bc42613bf2e7c46f84

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-05 15:59:21.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Make property protection tests use member

In order to avoid overriding the default policy in tests to be
completely unrestricted (as they are today), the property protection
tests need to add the member role into the roles being used to
test the additional permissions. This is because the actual default
policies require "admin or project member" permissions to do anything,
and just using one of the special roles will get blocked by the
regular policy before property protections are checked.

This could also be fixed by constructing a very complex policy for
these tests which allows those special roles to do their thing in
addition to member, but I do not believe this is how real deployments
would actually implement it.

These should definitely be reviewed with scrutiny to make sure that
all the assertions are still valid, and make sure we don't need more
than are already here.

Note that there are a couple assertions that were looking for CONFLICT
instead of FORBIDDEN on the special role attempt, but I think that
is likely a case of "test the current behavior not the desired one",
but I could be mistaken.

Change-Id: Ib6540223468421776f07745010e5d4afe5d58774

commit_message:
Make property protection tests use member role

In order to avoid overriding the default policy in tests to be
completely unrestricted (as they are today), the property protection
tests need to add the member role into the roles being used to
test the additional permissions. This is because the actual default
policies require "admin or project member" permissions to do anything,
and just using one of the special roles will get blocked by the
regular policy before property protections are checked.

This could also be fixed by constructing a very complex policy for
these tests which allows those special roles to do their thing in
addition to member, but I do not believe this is how real deployments
would actually implement it.

These should definitely be reviewed with scrutiny to make sure that
all the assertions are still valid, and make sure we don't need more
than are already here.

Note that there are a couple assertions that were looking for CONFLICT
instead of FORBIDDEN on the special role attempt, that seems to be
a case of "test the current behavior not the desired one".

Change-Id: Ib6540223468421776f07745010e5d4afe5d58774

commit_message:
Allow Barbican to talk to TLS'd mariadb

Barbican is NOT tls'ed, this is only for communicating with tls'd mariadb

Change-Id: Ia9598095456f35585eafa68f665d2a763e208571

commit_message:
keystone: Make internal TLS more robust

Keystone may communicate with other components that do not support TLS. This
patchset makes keystone more flexible and enable it to communicate successfully
with such components

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/800097

Change-Id: I5c697c1748b62a81b43e7b0d6c7f89d374a50d94

commit_message:
Fix test_network_quota_exceeding test

This patch makes sure that the test cleans up properly
default security group which gets created with the
new project from the setUp function.

Before, the test deleted only project and left the
security group unremoved.

The reason why the project is created in setUp function
is explained in [1][2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/e094bbade2b719fd531c2c8a7284ebfb1fb32efc
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1789938

Change-Id: Ie7381ee1a90fa8e075ca246c065eaec3c92e1092
Closes-Bug: 1925132
Co-authored-by: Aleksey Myltsev

commit_message:
Disable AMQP 1.0 SSL unit tests

Something broke in the way SSL certs are generated. Disable these
tests for now to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I9764da7995c198597661ecbea27efba9f76e53e3

subject: Move "Client disconnected" message to ECAppIter
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-05 18:57:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move "Client disconnected" message to ECAppIter

Previously we would log it once for each ECFragGetter, which is rather
noisy.

Change-Id: I599268931b2f8c9f7828f78c08832ac6acd9bbe4
'}]
commit_message:
Move "Client disconnected" message to ECAppIter

Previously we would log it once for each ECFragGetter, which is rather
noisy.

Change-Id: I599268931b2f8c9f7828f78c08832ac6acd9bbe4

This change uses new policy module to enforce tasks_api_access
policy check and excludes policy enforcement from the policy layer.

NOTE: Since we are excluding policy enforcement at policy layer, removed
below unit tests as those were checking controller methods and we no longer
enforcing policies at policy layer.
test_create_task_unauthorized
test_index_unauthorized
test_get_unauthorized

Change-Id: I670c076527b7bce55696b294d2283121dab5c707

Change-Id: I65b82d60fb31c8004e44c7a054e3d24cb28654fd
'}]
commit_message:
Move Tasks policy checks in the API

This change uses new policy module to enforce tasks_api_access
policy check and excludes policy enforcement from the policy layer.

NOTE: Since we are excluding policy enforcement at policy layer, removed
below unit tests as those were checking controller methods and we no longer
enforcing policies at policy layer.
test_create_task_unauthorized
test_index_unauthorized
test_get_unauthorized

Partially implements: blueprint policy-refactor
Change-Id: I670c076527b7bce55696b294d2283121dab5c707

Change-Id: I65b82d60fb31c8004e44c7a054e3d24cb28654fd

commit_message:
Let the orders complete before using them

This patch changes a test to wait a few seconds for the orders to be
processed by Barbican.  Currently there are intermittent failures when
the test executes faster than Barbican can process orders.

Change-Id: I863ca223d6732b43dd6baa1510d4206b34bfb19e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-19 14:50:05.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate create snapshot from share group in CephFS

Deprecate the create snapshot from share group feature
in CephFS drivers (both Native and NFS Ganesha).

This needs to be done since the subvolume group snapshot
feature is no longer supported in mainline CephFS, meaning that,
if we leave the call in place, an exception will be raised
from the backend and lead to an error status for the attempted
snapshot from share group.

Existing group snapshots can still be listed and deleted, so these
operations stay the same.

Closes-Bug: #1925332
Change-Id: I49efb7042d38257416875f40c03923e974b2eb8e
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate create snapshot from share group in CephFS

Deprecate the create snapshot from share group feature
in CephFS drivers (both Native and NFS Ganesha).

This needs to be done since the subvolume group snapshot
feature is no longer supported in mainline CephFS, meaning that,
if we leave the call in place, an exception will be raised
from the backend and lead to an error status for the attempted
snapshot from share group.

Existing group snapshots can still be listed and deleted, so these
operations stay the same.

Closes-Bug: #1925332
Change-Id: I49efb7042d38257416875f40c03923e974b2eb8e

commit_message:
[SVF]: Fix extend issue for a clone of rep-volume

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During extend operation the flashcopy
mapping between clone volume and its source volume having snapshots,
was not being deleted after copying, hence extend operation
is failing.

This fix is to properly stop the flashcopy mappings before extending.

Closes-Bug: #1920099

Change-Id: I336a8c92bfdd852cab42c9e5f992a30f3632bfaf

commit_message:
[SVF]:Bulk create Hyperswap volume is failing.

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During HyperSwap create volume
there is multiple lsmdiskgrp calls, which is causing more
concurrent calls on SVC.

This patch fixes the issue by caching the site information during
initialization and checking for HyperSwap pool site information.

Closes-Bug: #1917605
Change-Id: I3f734e55efeabcfdeca4c4f3e87bc4a5a0481875

[{'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-05 01:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-05 01:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Michele. I'm not sure why this argument was removed from the Ansible module or if it was necessary. I have proposed this fix to tripleo-heat-templates in anticipation that the argument was removed intentionally. But ultimately, you're better qualified than me to tell me if that is true or not."}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-05 01:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-08-05 05:39:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the heads-up, Brendan :)

So I'm a bit confused. The check_and_fail is still there in the ansible-pacemaker git repo:
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-pacemaker/blob/master/modules/pacemaker_cluster.py#L169

So I believe we now moved to the community.general calls via Ie96b3d35cea61370b1f98d7e060d696c4807c6b7 (review which happens to have 0 explanation as to why we did it..) and that is why things broke?

Is the community version pointing to some other git repo or something?

If anything I am tempted to revert pacemaker_cluster back to the non community.general version?
In the meantime I'll check the history of that parameter more in detail and see if we can actually drop it."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-08-05 08:57:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> If anything I am tempted to revert pacemaker_cluster back to the non community.general version?
> In the meantime I'll check the history of that parameter more in detail and see if we can actually drop it.

I'd propose to ditch it completely and replace it by pcmk commands via shell.
Given the trend with ansible vs directord future..."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2021-08-05 09:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> Thanks for the heads-up, Brendan :)
> 
> So I'm a bit confused. The check_and_fail is still there in the ansible-pacemaker git repo:
> https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-pacemaker/blob/master/modules/pacemaker_cluster.py#L169
> 
> So I believe we now moved to the community.general calls via Ie96b3d35cea61370b1f98d7e060d696c4807c6b7 (review which happens to have 0 explanation as to why we did it..) and that is why things broke?
> 
> Is the community version pointing to some other git repo or something?
> 
> If anything I am tempted to revert pacemaker_cluster back to the non community.general version?
> In the meantime I'll check the history of that parameter more in detail and see if we can actually drop it.

Probably it was miscommunication from my side. We are going to use Ansible 2.11 as "ansible-core" and all modules that have been part of Ansible 2.9 will be now as collections. So to use them we'll need to use FQCN (full qualified collection name) which include namespace and module name. It will be community.general, ansible.posix, ansible.utils, containers.podman and opentack.cloud collections for now. (kind of puppet modules we have)'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-05 09:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-08-05 09:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > 
> > If anything I am tempted to revert pacemaker_cluster back to the non community.general version?
> > In the meantime I'll check the history of that parameter more in detail and see if we can actually drop it.
> 
> Probably it was miscommunication from my side. We are going to use Ansible 2.11 as "ansible-core" and all modules that have been part of Ansible 2.9 will be now as collections. So to use them we'll need to use FQCN (full qualified collection name) which include namespace and module name. It will be community.general, ansible.posix, ansible.utils, containers.podman and opentack.cloud collections for now. (kind of puppet modules we have)

What would be the fully qualified name be for this since the proper git repo lives at github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-pacemaker ?'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-08-05 09:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

'}, {'created': '2021-08-05 09:09:34.000000000', 'message': 'Revert change to use community pacemaker_cluster module

The community pacemaker_cluster module is not in sync
with the real pacemaker_cluster module causing failures.

https://github.com/ansible-collections/community.general/blob/main/plugins/modules/clustering/pacemaker_cluster.py#L19-L39
vs
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-pacemaker/blob/master/modules/pacemaker_cluster.py#L32-L58

This causes failures in the minor update process.

Related: Ie96b3d35cea61370b1f98d7e060d696c4807c6b7
Closes-Bug: #1938967
Change-Id: Id65f0eef7249588d6038883f703d8e587826a4ac

commit_message:
Revert change to use community pacemaker_cluster module

The community pacemaker_cluster module is not in sync
with the real pacemaker_cluster module causing failures.

https://github.com/ansible-collections/community.general/blob/main/plugins/modules/clustering/pacemaker_cluster.py#L19-L39
vs
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-pacemaker/blob/master/modules/pacemaker_cluster.py#L32-L58

This causes failures in the minor update process.

Related: Ie96b3d35cea61370b1f98d7e060d696c4807c6b7
Closes-Bug: #1938967
Change-Id: Id65f0eef7249588d6038883f703d8e587826a4ac

commit_message:
Clean out deprecations from paste.ini

The etc/glance-api-paste.ini had still couple of pipelines left
behind from registry and osprofile options deprecated in 2015.

This change clears those and removes the reference note from
configuring doc.

Change-Id: Idb78cd2935a9ea5a1b1bc3ee6153311190422ca5

messages:
[{'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-07-20 12:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-07-20 14:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Topic fips removed'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-07-21 06:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2021-08-02 18:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-03 05:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-03 06:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-03 06:34:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-03 14:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2021-08-04 16:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-08-04 16:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-08-04 16:38:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

lgtm - though I'm wondering about the actual usage of the checksum... Aren't they recorded in some DB at some point? Since it's longer, it would be good to check the actual use of the returned value.

Hence the -1, just to raise awareness and ensure it's something that was taken into account."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2021-08-04 17:16:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Actually,  I'm not sure we can do this.

This code is used in tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py to get the checksum of the image file in two cases.

In the FileImageClientAdapter, it is used to check the checksum of source and dest image files to see whether or not they have changed.  Changing the algorithm here does not matter because the checksum is computed for both source and dest using the same file_checksum algorithm.

In the GlanceClientAdapter though, we get the dest image from glance - and that populates the image checksum data with whatever glance returns - which is md5.  So with this change, there will always be a mismatch.  This isn't going to change in the glance api.

This is a permissible use of md5 though - we just need to annotate as such.  The right solution here is to use the annotation we added to oslo_utils."}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-05 07:18:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
> 
> Actually,  I'm not sure we can do this.
> 
> This code is used in tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py to get the checksum of the image file in two cases.
> 
> In the FileImageClientAdapter, it is used to check the checksum of source and dest image files to see whether or not they have changed.  Changing the algorithm here does not matter because the checksum is computed for both source and dest using the same file_checksum algorithm.
> 
> In the GlanceClientAdapter though, we get the dest image from glance - and that populates the image checksum data with whatever glance returns - which is md5.  So with this change, there will always be a mismatch.  This isn't going to change in the glance api.
> 
> This is a permissible use of md5 though - we just need to annotate as such.  The right solution here is to use the annotation we added to oslo_utils.

That does seem like a deal breaker, yes. Although I'm wondering if at some point it wouldn't be a good idea to fix this on the glance side. After all, lot of bad stuff can happen if you substitute one image for another.


I'm abandoning the patch and I'll take a look at the oslo.utils decorator.
Can't seem to find it in the oslo.utils docs though.[0][1]
It is in the source however so I think it should be fine. 


[0]-https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/wallaby/reference/secretutils.html
[0]-https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/secretutils.html"}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-05 07:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

As the glance side of things is not patched, we can not remove the md5 use in this context yet.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2021-08-05 17:03:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> > Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > Actually,  I'm not sure we can do this.
> > 
> > This code is used in tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py to get the checksum of the image file in two cases.
> > 
> > In the FileImageClientAdapter, it is used to check the checksum of source and dest image files to see whether or not they have changed.  Changing the algorithm here does not matter because the checksum is computed for both source and dest using the same file_checksum algorithm.
> > 
> > In the GlanceClientAdapter though, we get the dest image from glance - and that populates the image checksum data with whatever glance returns - which is md5.  So with this change, there will always be a mismatch.  This isn't going to change in the glance api.
> > 
> > This is a permissible use of md5 though - we just need to annotate as such.  The right solution here is to use the annotation we added to oslo_utils.
> 
> That does seem like a deal breaker, yes. Although I'm wondering if at some point it wouldn't be a good idea to fix this on the glance side. After all, lot of bad stuff can happen if you substitute one image for another.
> 
> 
> I'm abandoning the patch and I'll take a look at the oslo.utils decorator.
> Can't seem to find it in the oslo.utils docs though.[0][1]
> It is in the source however so I think it should be fine. 
> 
> 
> [0]-https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/wallaby/reference/secretutils.html
> [0]-https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/secretutils.html

I'd certainly like to explore fixing this on the glance side.  It would be better all round if md5 ere were not required.

You can look at https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate/+/798157  for instance on how to use the oslo stuff."}]

commit_message:
Replacing MD5 use to comply with FIPS

MD5 hash calculated for images, was replaced with SHA256
which is approved under the FIPS.[0][1]

MD5 hash, while fast, is no longer considered sufficient,
as it is susceptible to collisions.[2]

Tests were updated accordingly.

[0] - https://csrc.nist.gov/projects/hash-functions
[1] - https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/fips/180/4/final
[2] - https://www.win.tue.nl/~bdeweger/CollidingCertificates/

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie3c7d0926e365d6d7fd3a4af17b31e84b1def4f5

commit_message:
Test created encrypted volume type

Created encrypted volume type is not tested properly
to know if that is created successfully or usable or not.

This commit adds the created encrypted volume type in bootale
volume creation request which is used to boot instance from.

Related-Bug: #1926630
Related-Bug: #1938763
Change-Id: Id16f5b57e88a1efe52a51a83656d770d190695aa

subject: Unset tempest.lib timeout in functional tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-29 22:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-30 02:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-30 02:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-30 10:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

failure in python-cinderclient-functional-py36, but it's not the timeout issue this patch addresses. 
 This time it's in CinderVolumeExtendNegativeTests.test_volume_extend_with_incorrect_size VolumeLimitExceeded: Maximum number of volumes allowed (10) exceeded for quota 'volumes'.  On this run, by the way, CinderBackupTests.test_backup_create_and_delete completed successfully in 45.485087 sec, which is under the "old" timeout limit of 60 sec.  We're running tests in 8 threads, though, so it's not too surprising that 10 might be too low a quota on volumes, especially if any tests are creating > 1 volume.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-30 10:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck python-cinderclient-functional-py36'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-08-02 12:07:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Review-Priority+2

By itself, this isn't a big deal, and the issue occurs intermittently (I think depending on what hardware the job lands on).  But each recheck also requires re-running tempest-full-py3, which is resource- and time-intensive.  I also want to point out that as far as the cinderclient test code is concerned, we have already accepted these timeout values (the shorter timeouts are caused by use of a non-obvious environment variable).

Let's get this change merged and backported soon."}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2021-08-04 14:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

XS patch looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-08-05 14:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-29 22:13:46.000000000', 'message': "Unset tempest.lib timeout in functional-py36

The test_cli.CinderBackupTests.test_backup_create_and_delete test
is hitting timeout errors in the python-cinderclient-functional-py36
zuul job.  This is happening because it's inheriting the
OS_TEST_TIMEOUT value of 60 from the base testenv, and that value is
being used by the tempest.lib class we inherit from as a timeout for
each test.  This is a problem for test_backup_create_and_delete
because it creates a volume, waits for available, creates a backup,
waits for available, deletes the volume, waits for deletion, deletes
the backup, waits for deletion.

Our functional tests have their own timeout handling, so turn off
the tempest.lib timeout and use ours.  An alternative to turning it
off is to set it at a value that respects our timeout for our longest
test, which would be:
- time-to-available: 120 sec (x2)
- time-to-deleted: 60 sec (x2)
that is, 360 sec.

This only seems to be happening for the functional-py36 job, so this
patch only makes the change for that tox testenv.

Change-Id: I33399b4c094af2cc059da6e332f4c0a91e6ab57e
"}, {'created': '2021-07-30 02:01:27.000000000', 'message': "Unset tempest.lib timeout in functional tests

Our functional tests have their own timeout handling, so turn off

off is to set it at a value that respects our timeout for our longest
test, which would be:
- time-to-available: 120 sec (x2)
- time-to-deleted: 60 sec (x2)
that is, 360 sec.

Change-Id: I33399b4c094af2cc059da6e332f4c0a91e6ab57e
"}, {'created': '2021-07-30 02:04:18.000000000', 'message': "Unset tempest.lib timeout in functional tests

commit_message:
Unset tempest.lib timeout in functional tests

The test_cli.CinderBackupTests.test_backup_create_and_delete test
is hitting timeout errors in the python-cinderclient-functional-py36
zuul job.  This is happening because it's inheriting the
OS_TEST_TIMEOUT value of 60 from the base testenv, and that value is
being used by the tempest.lib class we inherit from as a timeout for
each test.  This is a problem for test_backup_create_and_delete
because it creates a volume, waits for available, creates a backup,
waits for available, deletes the volume, waits for deletion, deletes
the backup, waits for deletion.

Our functional tests have their own timeout handling, so turn off
the tempest.lib timeout and use ours.  An alternative to turning it
off is to set it at a value that respects our timeout for our longest
test, which would be:
- time-to-available: 120 sec (x2)
- time-to-deleted: 60 sec (x2)
that is, 360 sec.

Change-Id: I33399b4c094af2cc059da6e332f4c0a91e6ab57e

[{'created': '2020-09-24 09:43:33.000000000', 'message': 'Display the reply queue's name in timeout logs

It would be helpful if "Timed out waiting for <service>" log messages at least
specified on which `reply_q` it was waited for.

Example without the reply_q:

```
12228 2020-09-14 14:56:37.187 7 WARNING nova.conductor.api
[req-1e081db6-808b-4af1-afc1-b87db7839394 - - - - -] Timed out waiting for
nova-conductor.  Is it running? Or did this service start before
nova-conductor?  Reattempting establishment of nova-conductor connection...:
oslo_messaging.exceptions.MessagingTimeout: Timed out waiting for a reply to
message ID 1640e7ef6f314451ba9a75d9ff6136ad
```

Example after adding the reply_q:

```
12228 2020-09-14 14:56:37.187 7 WARNING nova.conductor.api
[req-1e081db6-808b-4af1-afc1-b87db7839394 - - - - -] Timed out waiting for
nova-conductor.  Is it running? Or did this service start before
nova-conductor?  Reattempting establishment of nova-conductor connection...:
oslo_messaging.exceptions.MessagingTimeout: Timed out waiting for a reply
(reply_2882766a63b540dabaf7d019cf0c0cda)
to message ID 1640e7ef6f314451ba9a75d9ff6136ad
```

It could help us to more merely debug and observe if something went
wrong with a reply queue.

Change-Id: Ied2c881c71930dc631919113adc00112648f9d72
Closes-Bug: #1896925

commit_message:
Display the reply queue's name in timeout logs

It would be helpful if "Timed out waiting for <service>" log messages at least
specified on which `reply_q` it was waited for.

Example without the reply_q:

```
12228 2020-09-14 14:56:37.187 7 WARNING nova.conductor.api
[req-1e081db6-808b-4af1-afc1-b87db7839394 - - - - -] Timed out waiting for
nova-conductor.  Is it running? Or did this service start before
nova-conductor?  Reattempting establishment of nova-conductor connection...:
oslo_messaging.exceptions.MessagingTimeout: Timed out waiting for a reply to
message ID 1640e7ef6f314451ba9a75d9ff6136ad
```

Example after adding the reply_q:

```
12228 2020-09-14 14:56:37.187 7 WARNING nova.conductor.api
[req-1e081db6-808b-4af1-afc1-b87db7839394 - - - - -] Timed out waiting for
nova-conductor.  Is it running? Or did this service start before
nova-conductor?  Reattempting establishment of nova-conductor connection...:
oslo_messaging.exceptions.MessagingTimeout: Timed out waiting for a reply
(reply_2882766a63b540dabaf7d019cf0c0cda)
to message ID 1640e7ef6f314451ba9a75d9ff6136ad
```

It could help us to more merely debug and observe if something went
wrong with a reply queue.

Change-Id: Ied2c881c71930dc631919113adc00112648f9d72
Closes-Bug: #1896925

subject: Adding gate job for file backend thin provisioning
messages:
[{'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2021-02-17 08:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2021-02-17 08:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-18 06:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This looks good to me.

My opinion is we should add this job in next cycle.
The reason behind this is that we are already in last phase (2-3 weeks away) of releasing milestone-3 and there is lot of rush/delays in gate. If we add one more job then it will going to increase the delay as well (considering something went wrong and we need to recheck again).

This is my opinion though, lets see what others say about this.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-05-31 07:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This looks good to me!!'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-07-21 13:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck no recent results'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-08-05 15:36:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Nit noted inline.

I'm not against this, but I wonder whether (a) we have a test that would detect a problem if the filesystem thin-p is not working, and (b) could this be combined with another job (that is, do we have another job using the filesystem backend such that if it failed, we could easily tell whether the failure was due to thin-p not working vs. something else breaking)."}]

commit_message:
Remove SSL configuration section from docs

Since supporting only PY3 (Ussuri) Glance has not been supporting
termination of encrypted connection to the service [0]. The
section was left behind on the configuring doc.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/glance/ussuri.html#security-issues

Change-Id: I9356bceb914327f526da7b727fa58522ae18856e
Closes-Bug: #1930597

[{'created': '2021-06-23 13:51:07.000000000', 'message': 'Do not try to get container facts on deployment host

Kolla-ansible install python docker library in role/baremetal
to group/baremetal, because of this get container facts
is failing on deployment host.

This patch adding when conditional, so deployment host
will be skipped.

Closes-Bug: #1933347
Change-Id: Ifefb9c74ee6a80cdbc458992d0196850ddfe7ffa
'}, {'created': '2021-08-04 09:07:33.000000000', 'message': 'Do not try to get container facts on deployment host

Kolla-ansible install python docker library in role/baremetal
to group/baremetal, because of this get container facts
is failing on deployment host.

This patch adding when conditional, so deployment host
will be skipped.

Closes-Bug: #1933347
Change-Id: Ifefb9c74ee6a80cdbc458992d0196850ddfe7ffa
'}, {'created': '2021-08-04 09:12:29.000000000', 'message': 'Do not run timesync checks on deployment host

Kolla-ansible install python docker library in role/baremetal
to group/baremetal, because of this get container facts
for timesync checks is failing on deployment host.

This patch adding when conditional, so deployment host
will be skipped as there is no need to run timesync
checks.

commit_message:
Do not run timesync checks on deployment host

Kolla-ansible install python docker library in role/baremetal
to group/baremetal, because of this get container facts
for timesync checks is failing on deployment host.

This patch adding when conditional, so deployment host
will be skipped as there is no need to run timesync
checks.

Closes-Bug: #1933347
Change-Id: Ifefb9c74ee6a80cdbc458992d0196850ddfe7ffa
(cherry picked from commit 281c9935da076eb7a744136e3738084468692278)

commit_message:
Drop Fedora support

Fedora support is never tested, and has been unmaintained for a while.
Because we don't expect any actual user using OpenStack on Fedora, this
change drops support for Fedora directly.

Change-Id: I9ec4a576b576b6eea50a81846f1590ece73350d9

commit_message:
Update requirements and lower-constraints

Bring the versions specified in requirements.txt and test-req.txt
closer to what's actually being used in the py36 and py38 testenvs,
and update lower-constraints to reflect the updated requirements.

What has made this necessary right now is that the latest pip has
introduced a much stricter resolver, and the oslo lower-constraints
job is failing because oslo is imposing some constraints which are
too low for some dependencies, and we can't get away with that under
the stricter resolver.

Change-Id: I00872541844323a95ffb5ef60ca41cf36a75560c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-01 07:35:05.000000000', 'message': 'Cancel consumer if queue down

Previously, we have switched to use default exchanges
to avoid excessive amounts of exchange not found messages.
But it does not actually solve the problem because
reply_* queue is already gone and agent will not receive callbacks.

after some debugging, I found under some circumstances
seems rabbitmq consumer does not receive basic cancel
signal when queue is already gone. This might due to
rabbitmq try to restart consumer when queue is down
(for example when split brain). In such cases,
it might be better to fail early.

by reading the code, seems like x-cancel-on-ha-failover
is not dedicated to mirror queues only, https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1894,
https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1926.

By failing early, in my own test setup,
I could solve a certain case of exchange not found problem.

Change-Id: I2ae53340783e4044dab58035bc0992dc08145b53
Related-bug: #1789177
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749193/
(cherry picked from commit 196fa877a90d7eb0f82ec9e1c194eef3f98fc0b1)
(cherry picked from commit 0a432c7fb107d04f7a41199fe9a8c4fbd344d009)
(cherry picked from commit 5de11fa752ab8e37b95b1785f4c71210bf473f0c)
(cherry picked from commit 56bab1deab167e621d0a263f3fcf95b75c7d1bad)
'}]
commit_message:
Cancel consumer if queue down

Previously, we have switched to use default exchanges
to avoid excessive amounts of exchange not found messages.
But it does not actually solve the problem because
reply_* queue is already gone and agent will not receive callbacks.

after some debugging, I found under some circumstances
seems rabbitmq consumer does not receive basic cancel
signal when queue is already gone. This might due to
rabbitmq try to restart consumer when queue is down
(for example when split brain). In such cases,
it might be better to fail early.

by reading the code, seems like x-cancel-on-ha-failover
is not dedicated to mirror queues only, https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1894,
https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1926.

By failing early, in my own test setup,
I could solve a certain case of exchange not found problem.

Change-Id: I2ae53340783e4044dab58035bc0992dc08145b53
Related-bug: #1789177
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749193/
(cherry picked from commit 196fa877a90d7eb0f82ec9e1c194eef3f98fc0b1)
(cherry picked from commit 0a432c7fb107d04f7a41199fe9a8c4fbd344d009)
(cherry picked from commit 5de11fa752ab8e37b95b1785f4c71210bf473f0c)
(cherry picked from commit 56bab1deab167e621d0a263f3fcf95b75c7d1bad)

Thank you both for your feedback.

I assume this hits the TODO described here: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py#L451-L454

If it sounds reasonable for you i would update the request to include a new configuration option that allows toggling  this behaviour (while defaulting to the current behaviour)"}, {'account_id': 29074, 'date': '2021-08-05 13:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Comply with nas_secure_file_operations for qemu-img info

The operator can set nas_secure_file_operations to true if all operations
on the volume backend should be done without a root user.
For some reason the call to qemu-img info was forced to use the root user and
ignore this setting. This will render it impossible to use
nas_secure_file_operations without changes on the cinder rootwrap config.

Therefor we fix this here so that nas_secure_file_operations becomes usable.

Change-Id: I6587c12adfe2a346d220d14880a3010d05d1c900

commit_message:
Only add or remove router interfaces when needed

Previously, when updating a router all its interfaces where removed and
readded by Ansible's os_router module. As a unwanted side effect all
active connections of the router and nat'ed devices where dropped,
closing e.g. all active tcp sessions. Now, only necessary changes
are applied.

Task: 40136
Story: 2007845
Change-Id: I172caf360e6e342dd54865da5a5b72b0dc0205c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 17:29:25.000000000', 'message': "Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

commit_message:
Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

Change-Id: If7b3640191d84e5cf30cbbcb1cc94aa0f068d11c
(cherry picked from commit 2225f9666b157de773fc1dadf195034e24e2577b)
(cherry picked from commit d5b8ced547f5bf163b7ef76ef82a687af61434f9)
(cherry picked from commit 0b5b09c123a40a3f68cd8fb6be2f8da9fe91f31a)

commit_message:
Fail the overcloud deploy is ceph-ansible.yaml is included

TripleO recently concluded the migration to the new ceph deployment
tool (cephadm). The ceph-ansible.yaml environment file, however, is
still relevant in an upgrade context, where ceph-ansible rolling
update playbook is executed.
For this reason, this patch introduces a new validation to make sure
this environment file and the related registry resources can be used
during the update/upgrade context but not when a regular overcloud
deploy or stack updates are executed.

Change-Id: Iec23801a9eec1830469a53ab5ffc641125b5d3ff

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-18 13:38:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove flavor update and add param for it

This commit remove the default flavor update when a flavor exists
and a change is required, which consist of deleting and recreating
the flavor with the same name.

It could be hurtful on some operations as deleting a flavor with
virtual machines still spawned on it would remove the information.

This change alse add a param `update_flavor` (default to no/False)
which if set to yes/True restore the previous behavior.

Sign-off-by: Cyril Grosjean <cyril.grosjean@wifirst.fr>
Change-Id: I0fd13cc98c161067b614dddde29a01372672db01

commit_message:
[WIP] Add parameter to flavor recreation on update

This commit add a parameter `recreate_flavor` that if set to false
will make the module fail if a flavor already exist and needs to be
updated

This recreation process could be hurtful on some production envs,
as deleting a flavor with virtual machines still spawned on it
would remove the flavor information on the VM.

Sign-off-by: Cyril Grosjean <cyril.grosjean@wifirst.fr>
Change-Id: I0fd13cc98c161067b614dddde29a01372672db01

commit_message:
Adds option 'filters' to openstack inventory

Adds option 'filters'. Openstack SDK filters can be used to get
only subset of hosts matching metadata. Ansible variables
can be used to match hosts:

---
plugin: openstack
filters:
  metadata:
    external_stack_id: '{{ lookup("env", "TEST_ENV_STACK_ID") }}'

This is ported from original PR to ansible core:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/51401

Change-Id: I4dbb2ad0b554780e99ea92dba1a0f421ee812d80

subject: WIP Log openstacksdk logging to ansible logging
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-07-09 13:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-07-09 13:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-07-09 14:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-07-09 15:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-08-11 14:12:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

it didn't work for me, didn't see log messages in journal"}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2020-08-14 07:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

we need a different approach, module logging doesn't seem to work at all due to the specifics of running module somewhere else. If we want to integrate debug info of modules into the ansible-playbook output we perhaps need to a) return messages from module in the separate param (i.e. exit_json(msg=xxx, log=self.ansible.ALL_OUR_MESSAGES)) or b) write "remotely" to file and with callback_plugin fetch it and print to output.

Additional funny fact noticed in the sources of Ansible - module._debug is default to False and there is nothing what would change this (manually setting self.ansible._debug=True helps), thus we don't see anything at all.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2021-08-05 11:37:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch will be abandoned due to the long inactivity, please feel free to restore it in case you would like to continue to work on it. Thanks'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 12:28:25.000000000', 'message': 'Only remove/add interfaces when needed.

This is a first stab at the problem. I have reused some principles from
a fix for the same problem in a much older version of this module.

I'm not quite sure about the criteria for deleting a port. According to
the data structures, a port can have multiple (fixed ip, subnet) pairs.
However, given the description of a port ("A port is a connection point
for attaching a single device, such as the NIC of a server, to a
network."), multiple subnets make no sense (and multiple IP addresses on
a single subnet ony marginally). So some guidance here would be welcome.

Change-Id: I990098a5a33e0ccfbef9f853d3df7a1c30be7c8b
Story: 2007845
