commit_message:
Only remove/add interfaces when needed.

This is a first stab at the problem. I have reused some principles from
a fix for the same problem in a much older version of this module.

I'm not quite sure about the criteria for deleting a port. According to
the data structures, a port can have multiple (fixed ip, subnet) pairs.
However, given the description of a port ("A port is a connection point
for attaching a single device, such as the NIC of a server, to a
network."), multiple subnets make no sense (and multiple IP addresses on
a single subnet ony marginally). So some guidance here would be welcome.

Change-Id: I990098a5a33e0ccfbef9f853d3df7a1c30be7c8b
Story: 2007845

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Replace deprecated glance::api::database_connection

Database parameters in glance::api were deprecated in favor of
duplicated parameters in glance::api::db[1].

[1] 10f14f29b10d3cb427e74ef2ad2c45be1ae97842

Closes-Bug: #1938932
Change-Id: I8a0515e2d4e99fef7f4b3fa8fe0990f3f061cb52

subject: BFD support for Neutron
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 9361, 'name': 'Vivekanandan Narasimhan', 'email': 'n.vivekanandan@ericsson.com', 'username': 'viveknarasimhan'}, {'_account_id': 9531, 'name': 'liuyulong', 'display_name': 'LIU Yulong', 'email': 'i@liuyulong.me', 'username': 'LIU-Yulong'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 15554, 'name': 'Bence Romsics', 'email': 'bence.romsics@gmail.com', 'username': 'ebenrom'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-12-16 11:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-12-16 11:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-12-16 15:40:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(20 comments)

Very well written. Since we talked about this offline already a large part of my input is already incorporated in the initial version.

A few overall points:

The static route part is much closer to completion, I'm wondering if it makes sense to separate the implementation plan into two parts for static and dynamic routing.

I think it would be nice to be explicit about that in any IP field we accept both IPv4 and IPv6.

IIRC the BFD handshake has active/passive sides. I guess we are only aiming for Neutron being the active side, right? May consider exposing this on the API, just for future extensibility."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-05 16:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-05 16:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

thanks Liu for the review, I come back with the fixies, please check my answers in the mean-time'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-13 14:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-13 16:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-13 16:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-01-14 05:53:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

I stand by my verdict that this isn't a reasonable thing to do for n-d-r, thus the -2. I'm fine to remove it if you take n-d-r out of scope of this spec.

My feeling is that this is also not well thought out for the other use-case(s) and should be backed by a sample implementation before proceeding, but I'll leave it to neutron cores to decide on that."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-15 07:24:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6: Code-Review-2
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> I stand by my verdict that this isn't a reasonable thing to do for n-d-r, thus the -2. I'm fine to remove it if you take n-d-r out of scope of this spec.
> 
> My feeling is that this is also not well thought out for the other use-case(s) and should be backed by a sample implementation before proceeding, but I'll leave it to neutron cores to decide on that.

Thanks for the feedback :-). As I wrote earlier BFD is not just used for static routes but also for routing protocols like BGP. It's quite common, as I know, for switch vendors to give this option to admins to use the much quicker detection time of BFD to speed up BGP reconvergance/failure detection.

I just collected a few which are used by our customers:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_bgp/configuration/xe-16/irg-xe-16-book/bgp-support-for-bfd.html

https://www.juniper.net/documentation/en_US/junos/topics/topic-map/bfd-for-bgp-session.html

https://extremeportal.force.com/ExtrArticleDetail?an=000078861&q=How-to-enable-Bidirectional-Forwarding-Detection-BFD-protection-of-BGP-peering-sessions

So the goal is to give the possibility to admins to have the same feature available in Openstack as well"}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-15 07:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-01-15 08:51:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

BFD for BGP is useful if the device is in the datapath. neutron-dynamic-routing isn't."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-15 12:59:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> BFD for BGP is useful if the device is in the datapath. neutron-dynamic-routing isn't.

Thanks, I consider this."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-01-19 08:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-01-19 10:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-01-28 08:33:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2021-02-01 13:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

IMO this is getting close to complete.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-02-02 10:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2021-02-03 14:18:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Maybe we talked about this already, forget me if I missed something, but: In the bfd session establishment there's an active and a passive side. I believe we only target to support neutron being active. This may be worth mentioning somewhere."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-02-05 13:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-02-05 13:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Currently patches must come from review.openstack.org but it may
be useful to also source them from an alternative gerrit.

This patch adds a new parameter called 'gerrit_url' which is the
URL to the gerrit where the patch should be sourced from. The
default value is 'https://review.opendev.org' to ensure that it
maintains the current behaviour for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I84f2a7b9aae674d1971b4f64628ca59bf40419ad
(cherry picked from commit d93341dc6898ec807119e6fd1d92690b9f47bfa9)

commit_message:
Make the gerrit_url of patches configurable

Currently patches must come from review.openstack.org but it may
be useful to also source them from an alternative gerrit.

This patch adds a new parameter called 'gerrit_url' which is the
URL to the gerrit where the patch should be sourced from. The
default value is 'https://review.opendev.org' to ensure that it
maintains the current behaviour for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I84f2a7b9aae674d1971b4f64628ca59bf40419ad
(cherry picked from commit d93341dc6898ec807119e6fd1d92690b9f47bfa9)

commit_message:
update oslo.db version to 10.0.0

This patch[1] added handler for mysql 8.0.19 duplicate key error update,
and in device_profile create progress, we should distinguish the name
and uuid duplicate exception, so update oslo.db version to adapt.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.db/+/792124

Change-Id: I810cf892545eccd6255b01813a44e2c069ae5a7a

commit_message:
Add a member field to Image when appropriate

As noted by lbragstad, we need to make ImageTarget contain a member
field so that we can generically apply policies and be able to
properly include images for which we are a member. This was hacked
into place for ImageRepoProxy.get() but in order to apply it generally
to listing and other ops, we need to formalize that.

Partially-Implements: blueprint policy-refactor

commit_message:
Use payloads for ROUTER callbacks

This patch switches over to callback payloads for ROUTER
BEFORE_CREATE, PRECOMMIT_CREATE, BEFORE_UPDATE and
PRECOMMIT_DELETE events.

Change-Id: I4a52c773d3f753c918df0986f1d261083156651c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-04 14:17:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failing copy_image flow init

The new networkx requirement apparently causes us to fail the
test_init_copy_flow_as_non_owner test because a None value can not be
added to the flow graph. This just mocks out the glance_store call
that is failing to get the staging store to avoid us choking there
so we can proceed. We are just testing get_flow so we never use it
anyway.

Change-Id: I6fcb14ad240105ed0b1b9086c6c6c95034b4dd42
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failing copy_image flow init

The new networkx requirement apparently causes us to fail the
test_init_copy_flow_as_non_owner test because a None value can not be
added to the flow graph. This just mocks out the glance_store call
that is failing to get the staging store to avoid us choking there
so we can proceed. We are just testing get_flow so we never use it
anyway.

Change-Id: I6fcb14ad240105ed0b1b9086c6c6c95034b4dd42

subject: Do not fail if haproxy container UUID changes
messages: [{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-07-28 10:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-08-04 13:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-08-04 16:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck tempest'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-28 10:34:58.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail if haproxy container UUID changes

There is a possibility that haproxy container crashed and restarted
with another UUID, while the deployment is trying to reload it
after reconfiguring the certificates, by sending a
`kill -HUP <uuid-of-the-container>`. In that case, ingore errors
for the commands block, since there is no longer need to reload the
newly created container.

Related rhbz#1973674

Change-Id: I4b40d73ab329dc219ee7a387201b0747a6233ed4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 810b81991fd0ae48fa0a0e2049780f35dddbc8c6)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not fail if haproxy container UUID changes

There is a possibility that haproxy container crashed and restarted
with another UUID, while the deployment is trying to reload it
after reconfiguring the certificates, by sending a
`kill -HUP <uuid-of-the-container>`. In that case, ingore errors
for the commands block, since there is no longer need to reload the
newly created container.

Related rhbz#1973674

Change-Id: I4b40d73ab329dc219ee7a387201b0747a6233ed4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 810b81991fd0ae48fa0a0e2049780f35dddbc8c6)

I re-realized while doing this that all our functional tests run with every policy element disabled (i.e. wide-open). The stack underneath this is largely to allow us to take the default so we can even test the changes we make to update(). revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-05 15:59:21.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Make image update check policy at API layer

This implements the proposal at the PTG that makes the image update
API our first one to do all policy checks at the API layer instead
of the lower ones.

There are still some things that have to be resolved, like the image
repo will still check get_image even though we don't want it to.

However, this adds a new v2/policy module to encapsulate these checks
and adds them into the various places of the update call. It also
makes our test policy for modify_image match that of our actual
default, which is a major step in making sure our tests actually run
with the policy we expect at runtime.

NOTE: I have not fixed the property protection-related unit tests
here yet, so those will fail as expected.

Change-Id: I43dbc88a9f3fd4c6b2a10c2534ccee9283663282

commit_message:
Make image update check policy at API layer

This implements the proposal at the PTG that makes the image update
API our first one to do all policy checks at the API layer instead
of the lower ones.

There are still some things that have to be resolved, like the image
repo will still check get_image even though we don't want it to.

However, this adds a new v2/policy module to encapsulate these checks
and adds them into the various places of the update call. It also
makes our test policy for modify_image match that of our actual
default, which is a major step in making sure our tests actually run
with the policy we expect at runtime.

NOTE: db.ImageRepo.save() was raising NotFound in cases where
Forbidden was raised by _check_mutate_authorization(). This means
that we could not tell the difference at the higher layers between
an actual NotFound and the 404 generated by an auth failure.

The ImageAPIPolicy module will raise Forbidden for cases where an
operation is forbidden, but the image would be otherwise visible to
the user, and NotFound otherwise to obscure the existence of images
that the user can not otherwise see.

Partially-Implements: blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: I43dbc88a9f3fd4c6b2a10c2534ccee9283663282

commit_message:
Check get_image(s) in the API

This includes a change to catch Forbidden and convert to NotFound.
The previous Forbidden handler was not only correct (it shoud hide
the permissions error with "not found") but it was actually dead code,
since the DB was performing its own checks and would never raise
Forbidden.

This also includes a change of the default policy for get_images
to include the other states, like get_image does. I think this was
just an oversight in the original RBAC patches, which didn't matter
because they weren't really being honored strictly.

Partially implements: blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: I70100cd7f01da803e9740cea1f7ce7ae18ad6919

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-26 19:17:21.000000000', 'message': "Remove container name from the list when container is deleted

  When container is deleted, the container name needs to be removed
from the internal 'containers' list, and needs to be removed prior
to the wait/condense. Otherwise, 1) unnecessary requests are being
sent again in the tearDown for the subsequent methods, 2) race
condition can likely happen between methods during the tearDown.

Change-Id: I24087607a9f0129b7b3d21473196fab1b5f08cd4

commit_message:
Changes to ensure delete_containers is done at class level tear down

  Invoking delete containers at test level tearDown caused:
1) unnecessary requests are being sent again in the tearDown for
the subsequent methods,
2) possible race condition can happen between methods during the
tearDown.

Closes-Bug: #1938593

Change-Id: I24087607a9f0129b7b3d21473196fab1b5f08cd4

I didn't see this patch, since this repository is very much out of sight out of mind, but it looks like we completely lack policy setting capability for ironic-inspector which is also provided/managed via the manfiest present in this repository. On a plus side, it is similar to need as what has been done here, provide pass-through for the primary settings. Additional settings would be entirely redundant and ironic-inspector remains an admin-0only service moving forward. I'll try to start on it in the next week or so unless someone beats me to it."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-05 01:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix Usage of rdo-release rpm

rdo-release.el8.rpm rpm points to latest RDO release,
so use it for master, for stable releases use corresponding
release rpm.

Change-Id: I508eceb00d7501ffcfac73d7bc2272badb241494

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-03 10:46:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix undesirable raw Python error

Using the glanceclient without a subcommand while
passing an optional argument triggers the raw Python
error `ERROR: 'Namespace' object has no attribute
'func'`. This bug can be reproduced by issuing the
command `glance --os-image-api-version 2`.
Added a default value to `func` as placeholder
so that a help message is shown instead of the Python error.

Closes-Bug: #1903727
Change-Id: Ie4288262e408192310cbbc240bd1779b265a64fd
"}]
commit_message:
Fix undesirable raw Python error

Using the glanceclient without a subcommand while
passing an optional argument triggers the raw Python
error `ERROR: 'Namespace' object has no attribute
'func'`. This bug can be reproduced by issuing the
command `glance --os-image-api-version 2`.
Added a default value to `func` as placeholder
so that a help message is shown instead of the Python error.

Closes-Bug: #1903727
Change-Id: Ie4288262e408192310cbbc240bd1779b265a64fd

commit_message:
Hide the extra H1 heading in the docs

Hide the extra heading in the docs so we don't have double headers
showing up on each of the pages. Something changed in the wallaby
release that causes multiple headers to show. This patch introduces
some custom css to hide it for the time being.

Change-Id: Ia7c9dc8265e04cfb00ab33287a0685d7d26eee57

commit_message:
Hide the extra H1 heading in the docs

Hide the extra heading in the docs so we don't have double headers
showing up on each of the pages. Something changed in the wallaby
release that causes multiple headers to show. This patch introduces
some custom css to hide it for the time being.

Change-Id: I5994bacda8a420db2d095cb98d75347fdd5e3f6d

commit_message:
Make the gerrit_url of patches configurable

Currently patches must come from review.openstack.org but it may
be useful to also source them from an alternative gerrit.

This patch adds a new parameter called 'gerrit_url' which is the
URL to the gerrit where the patch should be sourced from. The
default value is 'https://review.opendev.org' to ensure that it
maintains the current behaviour for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I84f2a7b9aae674d1971b4f64628ca59bf40419ad
(cherry picked from commit d93341dc6898ec807119e6fd1d92690b9f47bfa9)

commit_message:
Rename x/tap-as-a-service to openstack/tap-as-a-service

We missed one location in Zuul configs where this is listed as a
required project. We need to update this name so that we can make
changes to project-config's zuul config.

Change-Id: Ifdc116115c9ef7773276aef5a6a69d4cf0b73367

We should not use OVN services.
Also Python 3 is now default.

commit_message:

be useful to also source them from an alternative gerrit.

subject: Add possibility to configure neutron ovs agent secgroup fw driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2020-06-25 14:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2020-06-25 14:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:29:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

this is already possible via a config override; it's actually documented as well here: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/networking/neutron.html#openvswitch-ml2-ovs"}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2020-06-26 22:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> this is already possible via a config override; it's actually
 > documented as well here: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/networking/neutron.html#openvswitch-ml2-ovs

Well, I know there is an option to change it this way, but I think this should be changed. It was also discussed some time ago in different review and was planned for ussuri, so why not do a first step ?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-27 07:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > this is already possible via a config override; it's actually
 > > documented as well here: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/networking/neutron.html#openvswitch-ml2-ovs
 > 
 > Well, I know there is an option to change it this way, but I think
 > this should be changed. It was also discussed some time ago in
 > different review and was planned for ussuri, so why not do a first
 > step ?

I guess it would be more kollish to just switch to native, modify docs and add a proper release note (upgrade) that the default switched and operators wishing to stay on old hybrid should provide an override for themselves.

One thing that pains me is that there is seemingly no smooth switch between the two. The best (most stable) way seems to be to disable the compute node, migrate away all the instance, switch it to new driver, migrate instances back and re-enable the node. Rinse and repeat for all the compute nodes."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-27 07:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Oh, and to clarify: I am very pro switch to the native driver.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-04-10 08:52:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Oh, and to clarify: I am very pro switch to the native driver.

What about this ? Should I write some migration docs ? Or abandon as it is lying here for a long time already.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-21 11:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > Oh, and to clarify: I am very pro switch to the native driver.
> 
> What about this ? Should I write some migration docs ? Or abandon as it is lying here for a long time already.

Abandon because this is already configurable I guess.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-04 20:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Convert all OS module imports to collections imports

Instead of importing code from 2.9 Ansible modules, start import
it from Openstack Ansible collection.
It requires Openstack Ansible collection to be installed and will
work with both Ansible 2.9 and 2.11
Change-Id: Ib3ebd504c4fc07296a62900981c40179af8d6037

Recent backports started timing out functional jobs in CI, where Bionic
nodes use 4.15.0-151-generic kernel.

Once relevant tests are executed, we get timeouts in many network
namespace operations, and following tests failing until node is
rebooted.

This can be seen in system log:
kernel: unregister_netdevice: waiting for ip6gre0 to become free. Usage count = -1

The ip6gre0 kernel log pointed me to a related follow-up upstream fix

[0] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=0d7a7b2014b1a499a0fe24c9f3063d7856b5aaaf

Change-Id: I9fe62c673e922186892c0cfb510788c0a7398ab4
Partial-Bug: #1938262
'}]
commit_message:
[stable only] Disable functional IPv6 GRE tests

Recent backports started timing out functional jobs in CI, where Bionic
nodes use 4.15.0-151-generic kernel.

Once relevant tests are executed, we get timeouts in many network
namespace operations, and following tests failing until node is
rebooted.

This can be seen in system log:
kernel: unregister_netdevice: waiting for ip6gre0 to become free. Usage count = -1

The ip6gre0 kernel log pointed me to a related follow-up upstream fix
[0], which s included in the current kernel [1], but apparently we can
still trigger a similar issue in ussuri functional tests.

Until this is sorted out, skip both tests making use of IPv6+GRE

[0] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=0d7a7b2014b1a499a0fe24c9f3063d7856b5aaaf
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/1930472

Change-Id: I9fe62c673e922186892c0cfb510788c0a7398ab4
Partial-Bug: #1938262

commit_message:
Introduce new HideSensitiveLogs parameter

This one toggles the no_log parameter. Directly related to #1873770 in
order to allow a deeper debug within CI.

Change-Id: I27f677467263c0e6cc78d775edff55b3811fec1f
Related-Bug: #1873770
(cherry picked from commit cabed543fa74014d17a6ac603bc2239237864b21)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-22 13:07:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix shibboleth compatibility for ubuntu 18.04

Package and module names were accidentally updated to equivalents
used for Debian and Ubuntu Focal+. This patch adds a temporary
vars file for Ubuntu 18.04 to maintain compatibility.

Change-Id: I50c649fda50b9e6a984abccdf61717a2294caaee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix shibboleth compatibility for ubuntu 18.04

Package and module names were accidentally updated to equivalents
used for Debian and Ubuntu Focal+. This patch adds a temporary
vars file for Ubuntu 18.04 to maintain compatibility.

Change-Id: I50c649fda50b9e6a984abccdf61717a2294caaee

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-08 17:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I take Erno's concerns seriously, so I feel that I need to address them directly and explain why I'm voting +2 on the spec.  I'm focused mostly on the question of is this a API-breaking-change, which I think was the majority of discussion at today's Glance meeting.

We need to distinguish between the Glance service and the Images REST API.  As far as the API goes, I don't believe that there is a contract that if you can make call X (e.g., image-update) you can also make call Y (e.g., image-show).  Looking at the api-ref, the documentation for "Update image" explains several preconditions and reasons why the call might fail [0], but it doesn't say anything about being able to make the "Show image" call.

Other than the api-ref, the other place to look for API guarantees is tempest.  Now the tempest test for "Update image" [1] does update the image and then goes on to verify that the change is visible by subsequently making the "Show image" call.  I would argue that this doesn't mean that the two calls are coupled, but rather that what's being tested is that when an image-update is successful, the result of the update should be visible in subsequent image-show calls -- not that the same user *must* be able to make these calls.  (But having these tests in tempest will be helpful in assessing that any policy changes made in implementing this spec honor the default behavior.)

In short, I don't think this change would call for a new API version because it really isn't changing anything in the API.

But, there's still the Glance service to consider.  Here I think Erno has a point, but I don't think it would be solved by an API version bump.  We're not going to be able to guarantee that any policy file deployed with Wallaby will have the exact same behavior in Xena.  What I mean is that it's possible that some operator has a file that prevents some set S of users from being able to update images and also prevents them from seeing images (the desired behavior), but this is because the policy configuration is actually only denying get-image to these users while leaving update-image wide open.  If this same file is used in Xena, the behavior will be different.

That's not great, but it's not clear to me what to do about it (other than to tell operators with custom policy files to review them carefully, and that hopefully they already have tests in place to verify their policy configuration).  We could try to duplicate the current policy coupling, just closer to the API layer, but it's not obvious to me that that there would be much benefit to that, because we certainly don't want to duplicate the coupling between the locations policies and everything else, which is a real big pain point for operators right now.

So, in Wallaby it's impossible to grant image-update without also granting image-show.  But I don't remember that being an intentional choice, or something that was specifically designed, but simply an implication of how the policy checks were implemented in Glance.  I think it just so happened that the common custom arrangement of custom policies into "observer", "creator", and "owner", where observer does all GETs, creator does all observer actions + POST, and "owner" does all observer +all creator actions + update and delete, doesn't reveal the coupling--but it doesn't assume it either (because it's being explicitly set up in the policies).  But once you go outside that observer/creator/owner paradigm, you run into all sorts of problems in writing policies because of their (hidden) coupling.

Finally, as Abhishek pointed out somewhere in the comments, Glance already adopted the new S-RBAC project persona following proper deprecation rules in Wallaby.  So operators have been warned that changes are coming.  I think overall they will be good changes, and may make it possible for more operators to use the default policy configuration, which will be tested to match the S-RBAC personas, and hence more secure.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/index.html?expanded=update-image-detail#update-image
[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/3a05fab1264dfd45a4127f16b649b060fe7eb836/tempest/api/image/v2/test_images.py#L347-L368'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-07-08 17:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-07-08 18:52:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Other than the api-ref, the other place to look for API guarantees is tempest.  Now the tempest test for "Update image" [1] does update the image and then goes on to verify that the change is visible by subsequently making the "Show image" call.  I would argue that this doesn't mean that the two calls are coupled, but rather that what's being tested is that when an image-update is successful, the result of the update should be visible in subsequent image-show calls -- not that the same user *must* be able to make these calls.  (But having these tests in tempest will be helpful in assessing that any policy changes made in implementing this spec honor the default behavior.)

Yep, and another way to look at this is: tempest validates that the change took effect so that the user doesn't have to second-guess glance every time. The tempest and functional tests should, ideally, be testing as many of the edge cases as possible so that we can be sure that the return code from the PUT call is reliably correct. That should, IMHO, be our statement of support, and address any concerns over the need to verify a result after the fact. If a bug were to be raised about the efficacy of a PUT, we'd want to write a regression test to prove it out anyway.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-07-13 14:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thank you Brian for detail analysis and inputs. As we have already started adopting S-RBAC related changes following proper deprecation rules, I think this is the right time to place things in correct order.

commit_message:
Consider tempest constraints set as env variable

Sometime TEMPEST_BRANCH and TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS are
defined in devstack localrc by jobs and sometime it is set as env
var(default devstack case when stackrc set these variable), we need
to check both way to set the appropriate constraints.

run-tempest or run-tempest-26 roles only take care of
devstack localrc case. This commit considers env var case
also

Change-Id: I4dce7930fb0e9e16b41c2cb56f9d5e593bda411e

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I324cd145da8469f505ae2c135ee5035ee7008ca1

numbers or lower-case letters. Some tests contain definitions of

numbers or lower-case letters. Some tests contain definitions of
reservation ID which doesn't match requirements.

This change fixes this minor problem in gentle way: appends
extra number to existing "r-fakeres" reservation IDs, uses
"r-fakeres1" and "r-fakeres2" instead of malformed
reservation ID where it helps to preserver readability and
introduces hardcoded reservation IDs when existing definition
doesn't match format at all.

Partial-Bug: #1746747
Change-Id: Icad539593111c352342026567f51253cd3a0b52b

commit_message:
Fix incorrect reservation IDs in unit tests

Reservation ID should start with "r-" prefix and contain 8 random
numbers or lower-case letters. Some tests contain definitions of
reservation ID which doesn't match requirements.

This change fixes this minor problem in gentle way: appends
extra number to existing "r-fakeres" reservation IDs, uses
"r-fakeres1" and "r-fakeres2" instead of malformed
reservation ID where it helps to preserver readability and
introduces hardcoded reservation IDs when existing definition
doesn't match format at all.

Partial-Bug: #1746747
Change-Id: Icad539593111c352342026567f51253cd3a0b52b

request query. It is insecure. NoVNC supports token passed in cookies,
which are at least not logged. Proposed patch makes Horizon using
cookies for this purpose.

Change-Id: I8f8359e8e17e8d83202f4ac00e1de3f78c119b27
'}]
commit_message:
Remove NoVNC authorization token from URL

Currently, Console tab in Instances dashboards passes NoVNC token in GET
request query. It is insecure. NoVNC supports token passed in cookies,
which are at least not logged. Proposed patch makes Horizon using
cookies for this purpose.

Change-Id: I8f8359e8e17e8d83202f4ac00e1de3f78c119b27

commit_message:
Include db classes explicitly

Since database parameters in the base classes were deprecated, it is
likely that db classes are no longer included automatically in a future
release. Let's ensure that the db classes are included so that
database parameters are always set.

Change-Id: I2a28cd1b7a92776b711eb784db3c4a486dcf6a85

designate charm: new options for creating DNS records'

This change documents the new charm configuration options:

Related-Bug: #1902923

subject: Add glance v1 tempest job in experimental pipeline
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 08:45:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add glance v1 tempest job in experimental pipeline

Glance v1 APIs are deprecated and there is no gate job
which run tempest tests for glance v1 APIs.

As we discussed on Rocky PTG[1] we need to test v1 till its code
is available on tested branches. Tempest will keep testing all the
deprecated APIs till they are being removed completely from all
stable supported branches.

Below Tempest patch provide a separate job to run v1 tests
and run that job as voting on check pipeline.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589076/

Glance does not need to run those as check or gate pipeline but at least
should run those as experimental so that v1 API can be checked on
request basis.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589076/

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-rocky-ptg-remove-deprecated-apis-tests

Change-Id: I105aa225f8fc146cb882bf788b001c790f6f24bc
'}]
commit_message:
Add glance v1 tempest job in experimental pipeline

Glance v1 APIs are deprecated and there is no gate job
which run tempest tests for glance v1 APIs.

As we discussed on Rocky PTG[1] we need to test v1 till its code
is available on tested branches. Tempest will keep testing all the
deprecated APIs till they are being removed completely from all
stable supported branches.

Below Tempest patch provide a separate job to run v1 tests
and run that job as voting on check pipeline.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589076/

Glance does not need to run those as check or gate pipeline but at least
should run those as experimental so that v1 API can be checked on
request basis.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589076/

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-rocky-ptg-remove-deprecated-apis-tests

Change-Id: I105aa225f8fc146cb882bf788b001c790f6f24bc

subject: Reintroduce x/tap-as-a-service shared ACL
messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-08-04 13:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-08-04 13:55:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nPer the referenced change's commit message, it looks like these two repositories can (and should) be retired."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-08-04 14:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-04 13:41:22.000000000', 'message': 'Reintroduce x/tap-as-a-service shared ACL

When x/tap-as-a-service was renamed to openstack/tap-as-a-service in
Iaa6fc7b0a9dca20ea77637a3890c603837ac7014 its ACL moved into the
openstack namespace along with it. However, because these move
changes are currently untestable, we did not spot that the ACL was
also shared by the x/tap-as-a-service-dashboard and
x/tap-as-a-service-tempest-plugin projects which were not included
in the rename work.

For now, add back the old x/tap-as-a-service Gerrit ACL as it
appeared prior to the move, so that our consistency checks will stop
failing unrelated changes. Separately, we can discuss the fate of
these other two projects with their stakeholders, and see what can
be done to clean this up a bit.

Change-Id: Iee2e37f47fee9ee1fb0016f87069d7cf90a30f5d
'}]
commit_message:
Reintroduce x/tap-as-a-service shared ACL

When x/tap-as-a-service was renamed to openstack/tap-as-a-service in
Iaa6fc7b0a9dca20ea77637a3890c603837ac7014 its ACL moved into the
openstack namespace along with it. However, because these move
changes are currently untestable, we did not spot that the ACL was
also shared by the x/tap-as-a-service-dashboard and
x/tap-as-a-service-tempest-plugin projects which were not included
in the rename work.

For now, add back the old x/tap-as-a-service Gerrit ACL as it
appeared prior to the move, so that our consistency checks will stop
failing unrelated changes. Separately, we can discuss the fate of
these other two projects with their stakeholders, and see what can
be done to clean this up a bit.

Change-Id: Iee2e37f47fee9ee1fb0016f87069d7cf90a30f5d

Thank you'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-08-03 08:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-08-03 10:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

LGTM thanks!'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-08-03 11:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So was the previous invocation broken or did cinder change the client in a way that is not backwards compatible? In the latter case, the fix IMO should happen in cinderclient.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-08-03 11:49:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> So was the previous invocation broken or did cinder change the client in a way that is not backwards compatible? In the latter case, the fix IMO should happen in cinderclient.

c-api has changed (Ia4b1c303a057fe70cf88bdbbebc1d4f62474f011) and now validates the provided cipher *before* calling down to create secrets. The previous call without a cipher worked in grenade as we were just using the test only fixed-key backend and not Barbican as documented in bug 1926630.

Additionally our grenade jobs always use LVM/iSCSI based volumes that pickup a default cipher from dm-crypt if one isn't provided, this only becomes an issue when using rbd volumes but this change should also correct that case.

IMHO updating this invocation to always provide a valid cipher is the correct thing to do here."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-08-03 12:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

after applying this, glance gate is reporting success on grenade job
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/803325'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-08-03 12:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > So was the previous invocation broken or did cinder change the client in a way that is not backwards compatible? In the latter case, the fix IMO should happen in cinderclient.
> 
> c-api has changed (Ia4b1c303a057fe70cf88bdbbebc1d4f62474f011) and now validates the provided cipher *before* calling down to create secrets. The previous call without a cipher worked in grenade as we were just using the test only fixed-key backend and not Barbican as documented in bug 1926630.
> 
> Additionally our grenade jobs always use LVM/iSCSI based volumes that pickup a default cipher from dm-crypt if one isn't provided, this only becomes an issue when using rbd volumes but this change should also correct that case.
> 
> IMHO updating this invocation to always provide a valid cipher is the correct thing to do here.

As Lee mentioned, there was no change in cinderclient rather added a validation on c-api side to fail early which previously failed later in c-vol. This mainly affects rbd driver and filesystem type drivers. IMO this is the right way to create an encrypted volume type and grenade should do the same."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-08-03 12:56:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

To me this still looks like exactly the kind of backwards incompatibility that grenade is meant to guard against, but I'm open to be overruled by other reviewers."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-08-03 13:16:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> To me this still looks like exactly the kind of backwards incompatibility that grenade is meant to guard against, but I'm open to be overruled by other reviewers.

Not a core reviewer, but this is about the  creation of the resources which are then checked to be still alive after the upgrade, and it will affect the xena->y upgrade. It is not about a behavioral change, so it should be fine."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-03 14:01:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > To me this still looks like exactly the kind of backwards incompatibility that grenade is meant to guard against, but I'm open to be overruled by other reviewers.
> 
> Not a core reviewer, but this is about the  creation of the resources which are then checked to be still alive after the upgrade, and it will affect the xena->y upgrade. It is not about a behavioral change, so it should be fine.

Hmm, I agree with frickler. This looks as if the backcompat was broken, i.e., previously-fine records are now breaking."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-08-03 14:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I agree with Lee and Rajat. As I understand from the original bug where cinder change happened (https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1926630) volume creation is going to fail at later stage so it was fixed as bug instead of microversion. I am fine to this change which is now passing what cinder validate in api now.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-03 14:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

It has been explained to me this was faulty behind the scenes and just never tested.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-08-04 13:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

enhancing the testing of volume type https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/grenade/+/803397'}]

commit_message:
Unblock Gate: create encryption type with right params

Recently we added a check in cinder for cipher algorithm[1]
Currently grenade is not passing cipher when creating an
encrypted type, hence grenade job is failing in glance and cinder gate.
This patch addresses the same by passing the cipher and other
properties.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/800268

Closes-Bug: #1938763

Change-Id: I1eb352deca11916f4db1010a50d15a83e33a61bb

was not tested.

[{'created': '2021-08-03 13:26:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add post-upgrade-configuration action

Add post-upgrade-configuration action which can be run after a Trilio upgrade.

Trilio sometimes updates packages in package repositiories that require DB
migrations or config file changes. Since these package updates are not applied by the
charm as they would be by changing the openstack-origin or triliovault-pkg-source
the charm has no event to react to to automatically perform the post package
upgrade actions. This change adds an action `post-upgrade-configuration` which can
be run to apply the changes.

commit_message:
Add post-upgrade-configuration action

Add post-upgrade-configuration action which can be run after a Trilio
upgrade.

Trilio sometimes updates packages in package repositiories that
require DB migrations or config file changes. Since these package
updates are not applied by the charm as they would be by changing the
openstack-origin or triliovault-pkg-source the charm has no event to
react to to automatically perform the post package upgrade actions.
This change adds an action `post-upgrade-configuration` which can
be run to apply the changes.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/613
Change-Id: I4dcc5d285e705c15ffc72c4497c3154877c7a44f

[{'created': '2021-07-18 16:02:27.000000000', 'message': 'Set NoopFirewallDriver when SGs disabled

Leaving firewall_driver unconfigured has expose an error
when configuring vlan trunk ports while security groups
are disabled. Setting it to NoopFirewallDriver allows it
to work properly.

Change-Id: I65ace64e0a71f78fa857481fff0a874cc018d7d8
Closes-Bug: #1934904
'}]
commit_message:
Set NoopFirewallDriver when SGs disabled

Leaving firewall_driver unconfigured has expose an error
when configuring vlan trunk ports while security groups
are disabled. Setting it to NoopFirewallDriver allows it
to work properly.

Change-Id: I65ace64e0a71f78fa857481fff0a874cc018d7d8
Closes-Bug: #1934904

commit_message:
[QoS] Add rule type packet per second (pps)

This patch adds new API extension to QoS service plugin
to allow CURD actions for packet rate limit (packet per
second) rule in Neutron server side.

NOTE: This patch will NOT implement the real functionality
in L2/L3 backend to limit the pps.

Co-Authored-By:  NANALI <lin203@chinaunicom.cn>

Closes-bug: #1912460
Change-Id: Icc88accb88d9cec40c960c56f032c3c27317b42e

commit_message:
Fix nova deployment failure when rabbitmq is disabled

Nova always tries to create the rabbitmq user regardless of
whether RabbitMQ is enabled or not.
This ps also adds an external rabbitmq doc.

Change-Id: Iec517226e4c82ea351889b55689a3efceaadcc76

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-06 08:29:58.000000000', 'message': "Synchronize network-vif-deleted event processing

When an attached port is deleted, nova receives an event
'network-vif-deleted' and processes it by updating network_info
cache and running driver.detach_interface.

The issue is that it may race with an ongoing interface attach
or detach run by manager, and lead to interface leak as
depicted in related Bug.

Currently, compute manager detach_interface/attach_interface
run synchronized, this change proposes to also constraint
_process_instance_vif_deleted_event method with the same lock.

Closes-Bug: #1934742
Change-Id: I29f5c39abc635f7cc1b250cfa6ee14d2629ba45c
"}]
commit_message:
Synchronize network-vif-deleted event processing

When an attached port is deleted, nova receives an event
'network-vif-deleted' and processes it by updating network_info
cache and running driver.detach_interface.

The issue is that it may race with an ongoing interface attach
or detach run by manager, and lead to interface leak as
depicted in related Bug.

Currently, compute manager detach_interface/attach_interface
run synchronized, this change proposes to also constraint
_process_instance_vif_deleted_event method with the same lock.

Closes-Bug: #1934742
Change-Id: I29f5c39abc635f7cc1b250cfa6ee14d2629ba45c

commit_message:
Install tripleo-operator-ansible from git for baremetal

In baremetal deployment, quickstart execution is done from
zuul node and quickstart depends on tripleo-operator-ansible.

Since https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/790701
already removed the git installation of tripleo-operator-ansible
and we cannot install it via rpm so the failure is legit.

In order to fix that, we need to install tripleo-operator-ansible
from git on zuul node.

Related-Bug: #1938638

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1fd588f02195dc09620f4950029faacb98b85eed

commit_message:
Do not run timesync checks on deployment host

Kolla-ansible install python docker library in role/baremetal
to group/baremetal, because of this get container facts
for timesync checks is failing on deployment host.

This patch adding when conditional, so deployment host
will be skipped as there is no need to run timesync
checks.

Closes-Bug: #1933347
Change-Id: Ifefb9c74ee6a80cdbc458992d0196850ddfe7ffa

commit_message:
Trivial fix horizon's healthcheck when SSL turned on

This patch is fixing docker healthcheck for horizon
by changing value of horizon_listen_port, so
both apache's virtualhost and healthcheck will have
same correct port always. Also removing useless
apache's redirect as all redirects are done on
haproxy side.

Closes-Bug: #1933846
Change-Id: Ibb5ad1a5d1bbc74bcb62610d77852d8124c4a323

commit_message:
Trivial fix horizon's healthcheck when SSL turned on

This patch is fixing docker healthcheck for horizon
by changing value of horizon_listen_port, so
both apache's virtualhost and healthcheck will have
same correct port always. Also removing useless
apache's redirect as all redirects are done on
haproxy side.

Closes-Bug: #1933846
Change-Id: Ibb5ad1a5d1bbc74bcb62610d77852d8124c4a323
(cherry picked from commit 6ac4638cfb83ee4a28b316fc646db9a594d5cc1d)

commit_message:
Add test for mac learning

This scenario test checks that, even with no DHCP and no port security,
packets are not flooded to every port on the network.

To see this work in OVN, port security and DHCP must be disabled on a
network. Before having those capabilities, packets would be flooded
to all servers. Now, the OVN switch can learn the MAC of a port and
store it on the FDB table. The adoption of this feature was completed
in [0].

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763567

Change-Id: I0313ac13f8e8922849f6388d2d1379817230294b

commit_message:
Fix freezed spice console in horizon

This trivial patch is setting "timeout tunnel" in haproxy's
configuration for spicehtml5proxy. This option extends time
when spice's websocket connection is closed, so spice will
not be freezed. Default value is set to 1h as it is in novnc.

Closes-Bug: #1938549
Change-Id: I3a5cd98ecf4916ebd0748e7c08111ad0e4dca0b2

s/1.1.0/1.1.1/"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-06-29 10:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is basically creating an invisible stable branch inside a release model that is designed for single-channel (master branch) releasing.

two slightly better solutions:
- switch to a true stable branch model if the end goal is to maintain stable branches based on openstack releases
- if the end goal is to close a corner case and it won't happen ever again, create an exceptional bugfix branch, and do a manual release from that (the way ironic does it, outside openstack/releases)"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-04 12:03:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

All the release managers agreed that this is not something that we want to do. We do not received response from the authors on our comments so I'll abandon this patch.

Thanks for your understanding."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-04 12:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: Release panko for stable/ussuri
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-23 20:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-07-27 08:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thank you, looks good in general.

This seem to fail because of the release-to-pypi job is missing?'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-27 13:04:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
> 
> Thank you, looks good in general.
> 
> This seem to fail because of the release-to-pypi job is missing?

Yes it is failing because of that [1] I'll double check with the team about how we could make it pass.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/54aeeeeae50c4f2f99636d86f8707fbe/log/tox/validate-request-results.log#135"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-04 08:37:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
> > 
> > Thank you, looks good in general.
> > 
> > This seem to fail because of the release-to-pypi job is missing?
> 
> Yes it is failing because of that [1] I'll double check with the team about how we could make it pass.
> 
> [1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/54aeeeeae50c4f2f99636d86f8707fbe/log/tox/validate-request-results.log#135

Weird...

`publish-to-pypi-stable-only` is well defined in the project-config for panko.

I compared the configurations of paunch and panko, those projects are in the same situation, they are no longer maintained but still with open stable branches, and I don't saw significant differences between [1][2] them that could explain why on one side (panko) we fail with an undefined `publish-to-pypi` and why on the other side the same config works (publish-to-pypi-stable-only).

The only difference that I found is that  paunch declare `release-type: python-pypi` on Ussuri [3].

On the gouvernance side, I found few differences between these projects. Indeed, paunch set `release-management: deprecated` [4] and that's not the case with panko [5].

I would suggest to start by trying to add `release-type: python-pypi` into panko's ussuri deliverable file [6]. If that doesn't help us, then I would suggest to set ` release-management: deprecated` on the panko config into the governance repo [5].

Let's see what will happen with that.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/src/branch/master/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L4354-L4366
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/src/branch/master/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L4374-L4388
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/deliverables/ussuri/paunch.yaml#L4
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L3089
[5] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L3010-L3015
[6] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/deliverables/ussuri/panko.yaml"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-08-04 09:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I suspect this is the first time we do a panko/paunch release since d7304b6416 merged on project-config:

https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/d7304b6416b7596fc3221f5989758db79642f8a9

We probably need to add publish-to-pypi-stable-only to https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/openstack_releases/project_config.py#L138'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-04 09:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-04 09:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I suspect this is the first time we do a panko/paunch release since d7304b6416 merged on project-config:
> 
> https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/d7304b6416b7596fc3221f5989758db79642f8a9
> 
> We probably need to add publish-to-pypi-stable-only to https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/openstack_releases/project_config.py#L138

Good catch!

I added it to our config https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/803452 and this patch is now rebased on the top of that.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-04 09:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-08-04 11:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Release panko for stable/ussuri

This release picks up new commits to panko since
the last release from stable/ussuri.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 8.0.0..0a8d5b4f
0a8d5b4f Add max_count argument for clear_expired_data call
4e8597a1 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
c47b5791 Update .gitreview for stable/ussuri

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I8c97acf6a72417363a6192a0e36728b9592257b6

commit_message:
tripleo-kernel: prevent reboot when TSX flag was added

During the 16.2 upgrade path, we enforce the inclusion of tsx flag by
operators. If there was already kernelargs present, the node won't get
rebooted, but if it's a new KernelArgs, the node will get rebooted as
per the related bug.

We want to prevent the unexpected reboot of nodes with workload when
the TSX flag was added.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1975240
Change-Id: Ib6140c8991469c950fd7e1b323c614103394e3f1
(cherry picked from commit a15e92511049e21c8bc76bf2fffa5bf6adb3b183)
(cherry picked from commit c647167f9d344b12022bce1677d4ef89930d6830)

commit_message:
Configure vhost-postcopy-support

Libvirt PostCopy helps with live-migration. For postcopy to work with
vhost interface, we need to configure ovs with other_config:vhost-postcopy-support=true

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567
Change-Id: If1239369b9c650ab62be58b4ae125cff120fa49a
(cherry picked from commit 2dec045cdd05265214ac757f915e7b59458e6e7f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-03 09:11:39.000000000', 'message': "zuul: Increase GLANCE_LIMIT_IMAGE_SIZE_TOTAL for nova-lvm

As seen before in bug #1913451 the nova-lvm job creates large RAW
snapshots during each run due to the nature of using LVM storage for the
ephemeral instance disks.

Id425aa546f1a5973bae8be9c017782d18f0b4a47 recently landed capping the
per teneant image size total to 1000 MiB that is far too low for this
job given the RAW snapshots it's creating. This in turn resulted in
504 failures when n-cpu attempted to upload snapshots to g-api.

This change simply increases the per tenant limit to 10 GiB that should
be more than enough for all of the tests covered by the nova-lvm job.

Closes-Bug: #1938765
Change-Id: I824655387a10ac9b813c1b7b2399e25ed95f7fc3
"}]
commit_message:
zuul: Increase GLANCE_LIMIT_IMAGE_SIZE_TOTAL for nova-lvm

As seen before in bug #1913451 the nova-lvm job creates large RAW
snapshots during each run due to the nature of using LVM storage for the
ephemeral instance disks.

Id425aa546f1a5973bae8be9c017782d18f0b4a47 recently landed capping the
per teneant image size total to 1000 MiB that is far too low for this
job given the RAW snapshots it's creating. This in turn resulted in
504 failures when n-cpu attempted to upload snapshots to g-api.

This change simply increases the per tenant limit to 10 GiB that should
be more than enough for all of the tests covered by the nova-lvm job.

Closes-Bug: #1938765
Change-Id: I824655387a10ac9b813c1b7b2399e25ed95f7fc3

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-30 09:38:10.000000000', 'message': "Use elevated context to get default SG from database

With new system/project scopes it may happen that project admin
will try to list security groups for different project and during
that call Neutron will ensure that default security group is created.

In such case elevated context needs to be used to get SG object from
the database otherwise, SG will not be found and error 500 will be
returned through the API.

Use of elevated context is fine here as if user don't have access to
the SG, it will be filtered out by policy mechanism and it will not
be returned through API.

Closes-Bug: #1934115
Change-Id: I0ca07d1a1aaf05c1992aea9e29575580d7933324
"}]
commit_message:
Use elevated context to get default SG from database

With new system/project scopes it may happen that project admin
will try to list security groups for different project and during
that call Neutron will ensure that default security group is created.

In such case elevated context needs to be used to get SG object from
the database otherwise, SG will not be found and error 500 will be
returned through the API.

Use of elevated context is fine here as if user don't have access to
the SG, it will be filtered out by policy mechanism and it will not
be returned through API.

Closes-Bug: #1934115
Change-Id: I0ca07d1a1aaf05c1992aea9e29575580d7933324

commit_message:

rdo-release.el8.rpm rpm points to latest RDO release,
so use it for master, for stable releases use corresponding
release rpm.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-02 11:52:45.000000000', 'message': 'Removing optional fields from insert_media payload

Removing "Inserted" and "WriteProtected" from the
VirtualMedia::insert_media() API call payload when PATCH method of
configuring virtual media is not used (e.g. InserMedia action) and
values are set to defaults as per Redfish specification
(https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/VirtualMedia.v1_3_0.json):
{"Inserted": true, "WriteProtected": True}.

"Inserted" and "WriteProtected" attributes to VirtualMedia::insert_media()
are optional and should have reasonable default values on the BMC side.
Specifying them in every insert_media call can cause issues on those BMCs that
treat them as read-only and not specifying these attributes at all should
not cause issues. SuperMicro X11/X12 platforms can be such example -
vMedia will not work on these without this fix.
Keeping old behaviour in BMCs using PATCH request for configuring
virtual media (e.g. Lenovo SD530) as these may need "Inserted" attribute
to attach virtual media correctly.

Story: 2009086
Task: 42907
rhbz#1986238

Change-Id: I975b3a4aa53704906cb13c859b61a254de79933f
(cherry picked from commit 11a6de24ef7fc735d8a46fe0c1e336f8e099622f)
'}]
commit_message:
Removing optional fields from insert_media payload

Removing "Inserted" and "WriteProtected" from the
VirtualMedia::insert_media() API call payload when PATCH method of
configuring virtual media is not used (e.g. InserMedia action) and
values are set to defaults as per Redfish specification
(https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/VirtualMedia.v1_3_0.json):
{"Inserted": true, "WriteProtected": True}.

"Inserted" and "WriteProtected" attributes to VirtualMedia::insert_media()
are optional and should have reasonable default values on the BMC side.
Specifying them in every insert_media call can cause issues on those BMCs that
treat them as read-only and not specifying these attributes at all should
not cause issues. SuperMicro X11/X12 platforms can be such example -
vMedia will not work on these without this fix.
Keeping old behaviour in BMCs using PATCH request for configuring
virtual media (e.g. Lenovo SD530) as these may need "Inserted" attribute
to attach virtual media correctly.

Story: 2009086
Task: 42907
rhbz#1986238

Change-Id: I975b3a4aa53704906cb13c859b61a254de79933f

commit_message:
Allow for cron programming of backups

Normally, backups are not done interactively, but during nights or
weekends. This patch introduces the capacity of introducing in an easy
way cron programming that will execute backups in predictable intervals.

Closes-Bug: #1935675

Depends-on: I86b3fb2c3d846bcd56859e0d572f1fe4d5e148fa
Change-Id: I28219759922b7407121a3fa4d2f49ee1f4b8a3cd
(cherry picked from commit c5347fbac354099852ba9d2f7291485704f7922d)

commit_message:
Add config options to handle SOA records.

New configuration options:

- default-ttl
- default-soa-minimum
- default-soa-refresh-min
- default-soa-refresh-max
- default-soa-retry

Change-Id: I2ad0aec7d50a36e9e5227a08295aef4e99130d78
Closes-Bug: #1902923
Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/457

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-05 15:59:21.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Refactor gateway get_repo auth layer

This makes us able to optionally not get the authorization layer on
top of the stack. The authorization layer makes everything on an
Image read-only based on hard-coded checks for "owner or admin".
If we are going to move to using policy to enforce modifications
to images, I believe we need to discard this layer.

This patch cleans up the stacking to be a little more modular, and
adds a flag to control whether or not we get the authorization layer
on top or not.

Change-Id: Ie8bea199175a0eb35428b1508af1c49111a87c37

commit_message:
Refactor gateway get_repo auth layer

This makes us able to optionally not get the authorization layer on
top of the stack. The authorization layer makes everything on an
Image read-only based on hard-coded checks for "owner or admin".
If we are going to move to using policy to enforce modifications
to images, we need to discard this layer.

When the flag is True we also don't insert the policy layer in the
middle of the stack.

This patch cleans up the stacking to be a little more modular, and
adds a flag to control whether or not we get the authorization layer
on top or not.

Partially-Implements: blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: Ie8bea199175a0eb35428b1508af1c49111a87c37

commit_message:
Add lower-constraints job to current development branch

The lower-constraints test was removed becuase of an issue where pip
could not correctly determine the required packages versions to install,
ending in an almost infinite loop that would end up in timeout, failure,
and general mayhem.
Recently the issue has been fixed and, if properly configured, the
lower-constraints test can provide good indication of which minimum
versions are required to support the current code.
This patch adds the test back to the current development branch.
The long term goal is to keep the lower-constraints file in the stable
branches, but remove the test job to avoid issues during backports.

Change-Id: I5fff32ec5dd1a045116bcf02349650b1f5e3a196

'}, {'created': '2021-07-28 22:50:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix testes

- Cap bandit to 1.6.2. Reference [1]
- Replace python with python3 commend in docker build script

commit_message:
Fix testes

- Cap bandit to 1.6.2. Reference [1]
- Replace python with python3 commend in docker build script
- Workaround for new pip 20.3 behavior [2]
- Change monasca-tempest to non-voting

[1] https://github.com/openstack/monasca-notification/commit/293306e14dfaa775211bcf7d9b5542cd61fb8bd6
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/monasca-api/+/784094

Change-Id: I3356063e4ffb4490ef92acf9a002ae9c316c2584

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-15 09:02:47.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

(cherry picked from Neutron e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

(cherry picked from Neutron e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Enable ansible-test sanity checks (nv)

Adds non-voting check jobs for ansible-test sanity and fixing many
problems identified by these. We will sort the other problems in
follow-up(s) and make the job voting. This approach will ease
reviewing and prevent creating conflicts with other pending changes.

Story: https://projects.engineering.redhat.com/browse/TRIPLEOCI-559
Change-Id: I29ce27114e0675fb5d00614df506675bfbe5bf96

commit_message:
Add TestNetworkBasicOps.test_subnet_details to skip list

As the bug fix https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/794776
is going to take time, in order to unblock upstream job,
moving the test to skip list.

Related-Bug: #1914229

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6f3ac2efc65ca40a4c4556f77843555eb0d44282

commit_message:
remove unicode from code

In Python 3, all strings are represented in Unicode.In Python 2 are
stored internally as 8-bit ASCII, hence it is required to attach 'u'
to make it Unicode. It is no longer necessary now.'

Change-Id: Ie3a439f0113423771bee7fb36b353df0ed68892e

That's a good question.
Since https://artifacts.ci.centos.org/rdo/jenkins-tripleo-quickstart-promote-wallaby-current-tripleo-delorean-minimal-24/console.log is a libvirt based deployment 
```
 ansible-playbook -vv /home/jenkins/workspace/tripleo-quickstart-promote-wallaby-current-tripleo-delorean-minimal/playbooks/quickstart-extras.yml -e @/home/jenkins/workspace/tripleo-quickstart-promote-wallaby-current-tripleo-delorean-minimal/config/release/centosci/wallaby-current-tripleo.yml -e @/home/jenkins/workspace/tripleo-quickstart-promote-wallaby-current-tripleo-delorean-minimal/config/nodes/1ctlr_1comp.yml -e @/home/jenkins/workspace/tripleo-quickstart-promote-wallaby-current-tripleo-delorean-minimal/config/general_config/minimal.yml -e @/home/jenkins/workspace/tripleo-quickstart-promote-wallaby-current-tripleo-delorean-minimal/config/environments/default_libvirt.yml -e local_working_dir=/home/jenkins/workspace/tripleo-quickstart-promote-wallaby-current-tripleo-delorean-minimal -e virthost=172.19.2.14 -e deploy_timeout=120 -t all,teardown-nodes
```

It is a libvirt based deployment where we first create the undercloud and overcloud vms using https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/playbooks/quickstart.yml#L48 libvirt/setup role where 
* it first downloads the images [https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml#L38] 
* Then perform image related operations like modifying the image and injecting gating repo and deploying undercloud.

Here since repo-setup part is not getting executed so undercloud_rpm_dependencies var coming from release file is not used So it is not picked up."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2021-08-02 07:36:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

'}, {'created': '2021-08-02 11:19:52.000000000', 'message': 'Added provision/tqe_deps role

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/790701
Remove tripleo-operator-ansible from TQE requires and it needs to
be installed via rpm.

For an end user, where deployment is provisioned via tqe/libvirt
role there TQE playbooks are failing as tripleo-operator-ansible
collection is not found on the virthost.

are not in play so we are introducing a new role to install
these packages.

to false and then install tqe requires packages.

Remove tripleo-operator-ansible from TQE requires and it needs to
be installed via rpm.

For an end user, where deployment is provisioned via tqe/libvirt

collection is not found on the virthost.

these packages.

repo-setup-virthost.yml playbook was already there which generally
got used in CentOS CI check jobs, but in order to install
TQE deps in all libvirt deployment, it needs to enable by default
and install the packages.

While using this playbook, the vars are kept at multiple places
leading to failure, so we moving repo setup and package installation
task in a single role and enable it by default by setting
virthost_repo_setup: true and move these vars as a part of this role.

commit_message:
Added provision/virt_repo_setup role

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/790701
Remove tripleo-operator-ansible from TQE requires and it needs to
be installed via rpm.

For an end user, where deployment is provisioned via tqe/libvirt
role there TQE playbooks are failing as tripleo-operator-ansible
collection is not found on the virthost.

In order to install the same, we cannout use release file as those
are not in play so we are introducing a new role to install
these packages.

repo-setup-virthost.yml playbook was already there which generally
got used in CentOS CI check jobs, but in order to install
TQE deps in all libvirt deployment, it needs to enable by default
and install the packages.

While using this playbook, the vars are kept at multiple places
leading to failure, so we moving repo setup and package installation
task in a single role and enable it by default by setting
virthost_repo_setup: true and move these vars as a part of this role.

The repo needs to be enabled on the localhost also.

Close-Bug: #1938638

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idd1ff9624e1e1271aef300a7069c066cbe8abcb0

Change-Id: Ifc9a6695f2c79c6bdae12f0899a56d5cbda90e80
(cherry picked from commit 3d53a15819ca30c8cfd5eb850d66960ed6505405)
'}]
commit_message:
Run Ceph upgrade only once.

The ceph ugprade playbook was being called twice, which did spend extra
time for the test.

It should be enough to upgrade ceph only once.

Change-Id: Ifc9a6695f2c79c6bdae12f0899a56d5cbda90e80
(cherry picked from commit 3d53a15819ca30c8cfd5eb850d66960ed6505405)

commit_message:
Add angular security groups panel

This patch adds an angular security groups table.

To be added in subsequent patches:
  - Create Action
  - Delete Action
  - Edit Action
  - Manage security group rules
    a) List security groups rules
    b) Create security group rule
    c) Delete security group rule

To test, set 'security_groups_panel' to True in settings.py

Change-Id: Ia275d0c765d05016e271fb28cc7bc2a51bf8dbea
Implements: blueprint ng-security-groups

commit_message:
Disable create and import keypair button when keypair quota exceeded

Now in angular create instance page, we can create or import keypair,
sometimes if keypair quota exceeded, it will cause the failure of the
API calls, and return "Quota exceeded, too many key pairs. (HTTP 403)".
So, like the keypairs panel, also add the keypair quota check in
angular create instance page.

Change-Id: If9a96df08f17b5a0cedaf0d146ec1714f73286f5
Closes-Bug:#1709765

commit_message:
Add angular server groups admin panel

Add server groups panel under Admin->Compute panel group.
The server groups panel contains delete action and its details
page (the details page contains the basic details of the
server group and server group members details)

Change-Id: I8e677ac734091a4f5ea86788b7471be1f6bf07d1
Implements: blueprint ng-server-groups

> Personally, I prefer to show disabled actions instead of hiding

Hi Ivan. Thanks for your comments.

Currently, disable table row action buttons used only in one case in horizon, when a resource quota is exceeded, will disable the button and add text descriptions, such as the following two conditions [1] [2]. We can search for the keyword 'self.classes' in the openstack_dashboard directory.
[1] Create Subnet: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/tables.py#L120
[2] Create Keypair: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/key_pairs/tables.py#L53

In other cases, there are hidden buttons, such as the two below. We can also search for keyword 'def allowed' in the openstack_dashboard directory.
[1] Extend Volume: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/tables.py#L165

commit_message:
Hide some actions when the instance is locked for non-admin users

When the instance is locked, the following actions are not allowed for
non-admin users.

Actions:
 - StartInstance and StopInstance
 - RebootInstance and SoftRebootInstance
 - ResizeLink and ConfirmResize and RevertResize
 - AttachInterface and DetachInterface
 - AttachVolume and DetachVolume
 - UpdateMetadata
 - TogglePause, ToggleSuspend and ToggleShelve
 - RebuildInstance
 - DeleteInstance

This patch fixes the actions of the project-instances, project-volumes
page, hide the actions when the instance is locked.

Change-Id: I4c88c7f47c305026a5759122fb8e82cdd0c753fb
Closes-Bug:#1433847
Closes-Bug:#1573566

commit_message:
Wire up renamed upgrade periodic template

The template being wired up here is added in depends-on by renaming
the existing periodic upgrade templates. See [1] for the context,
but the result is we will now only run these jobs once in periodic.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/797865/17#message-ca33adc95782a24a6579df7552af5096a0ac8274
Depends-On: Iabe367d2e170bec44820a70c0760d8beea49ec92

Change-Id: I474a5da79ebd570aa1fe3e763e8aaedbdbd09879
